Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Alaska Airlines just began flying the Boeing 737 Max in March after waiting years for its first model. </li>\n<li>Just over a month after the first flight of the Max, the airline was forced to ground the fleet. </li>\n<li>I flew on Alaska&#39;s Boeing 737 Max in March and found it to be a modern marvel. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tAlaska Airlines became the fourth US airline to fly the Boeing 737 Max when it took delivery of its long-delayed first model in January.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075e5973e3fe7001882a6fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max\" height=\"1664\" width=\"2225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alaska Airlines</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em><strong>Read More:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alaska-airlines-takes-delivery-of-first-boeing-737-max-2021-1\" data-analytics-position=\"7\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Alaska Airlines just took delivery of its first Boeing 737 Max, becoming the 4th in the US to fly the controversial jet</a></em></p>\n\tBoeing's troubled narrow-body was supposed to arrive at the airline in 2019 but the March 2019 crash of Ethiopian Airlines flight 302 and the subsequent grounding of Max aircraft worldwide changed that.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6076f49c74da0300181e193f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max\" height=\"1352\" width=\"1803\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alaska Airlines</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFollowing the ungrounding in November 2020, Alaska quickly took delivery of its first model and began a flight testing campaign that spanned around 50 hours and 19,000 miles. And on March 1, Alaska finally began passenger flights with the aircraft.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6076f47e420615001817563c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flying on Alaska Airlines during pandemic\" height=\"1874\" width=\"2498\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on Alaska Airlines during the pandemic\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em><strong>Read More:</strong></em> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alaska-airlines-debuts-boeing-737-max-on-first-passenger-flight-2021-3\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Airlines continue to flock to the Boeing 737 Max as it debuts on Alaska and United places a massive new order</a></p>\n\tJust over one month following the aircraft's arrival at Alaska, however, Boeing recommended that all four of the airline's models be grounded for an electrical issue. \"The recommendation is being made to allow for verification that a sufficient ground path exists for a component of the electrical power system,\" Boeing said in a statement, with no timeline for the fix.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6077034442061500181756b5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Boeing 737 Max\" height=\"1208\" width=\"1611\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Boeing 737 Max aircraft of Alaska Airlines, Southwest Airlines, and Gol Linhas Aéreas.\n<p class=\"copyright\">LINDSEY WASSON/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em><strong>Read More:</strong> </em><em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/boeing-737-max-new-electrical-issue-southwest-american-airlines-2021-4\" data-analytics-position=\"7\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Boeing's infamous 737 Max plane has a new issue, and 16 airlines are being told to ground planes</a></em></p>\n\tThe Max is Alaska's future with Boeing landing a frim deal for 68 aircraft to be bought and leased by the airline, with options for 52 more.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607704a674da0300181e19a9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max\" height=\"892\" width=\"1190\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alaska Airlines</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em><strong>Read More: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alaska-airlines-buys-more-boeing-737-max-adds-alaska-routes-2020-12\" data-analytics-position=\"16\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Alaska Airlines is buying another 23 Boeing 737 Max jets for a total of 68 and adding new routes to its namesake state</a></em></p>\n\tI flew on one of Alaska's Boeing 737 Max aircraft just three weeks before the grounding from Seattle to Los Angeles. Here's what it was like.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075df5c74da0300181e16ea?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flying on Alaska Airlines during pandemic\" height=\"1493\" width=\"1991\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on Alaska Airlines during the pandemic\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><em>Read More: </em></strong><em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/flying-alaska-airlines-during-the-pandemic-review-photos-2021-4\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">I flew on Alaska for the first time since it stopped blocking middle seats and it was the closest to normal I've seen during the pandemic</a></em></p>\n\tAlaska has kept its Max aircraft to West Coast routes flying to cities like San Diego and Los Angeles. On the day I was flying, two aircraft were flying eight daily flights up and down the coast.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5383e3fe7001882a531?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tLike most US airlines flying the Max aircraft, Alaska has vowed to be flexible with customers that don't want to fly the Max. But they'd have to know they were flying on the Max and it wasn't easy to find.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075f8e974da0300181e1788?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"964\" width=\"1286\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider via Alaska Airlines</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe only way to see what aircraft you're flying on with Alaska during booking is by clicking \"details.\" Only then will the aircraft type reveal itself.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607704cf42061500181756c5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1107\" width=\"1476\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider via Alaska Airlines</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere was no subsequent warning that I'd be booking on the Max either, as other airlines like United did in the early days of the Max return to service. Alaska did, however, show the aircraft's name at the top of the seat map...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6077160f74da0300181e1a4f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"895\" width=\"1194\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider via Alaska Airlines</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd it was displayed on the monitor at the gate.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607716184206150018175752?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flying on Alaska Airlines during pandemic\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on Alaska Airlines during the pandemic\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAlaska operates the largest Max model currently flying, the Boeing 737 Max 9. It's the next-generation variant of the 737-900ER Next Generation, which Alaska also flies.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607716204206150018175753?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flying on Alaska Airlines during pandemic\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on Alaska Airlines during the pandemic\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tImmediately upon stepping onboard I could tell it was a modern marvel.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5492cc1ef0018da16e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe first class cabin features 16 seats in a standard 2-2 configuration across just four rows.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a53a2cc1ef0018da16d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe seats are large plush recliners with massive adjustable headrests. I was extremely dissapointed I couldn't sit up here for the flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5433e3fe7001882a533?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeat-backs feature large literature holders and while there are no in-flight entertainment screens, device holders are found attached to the tray table.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5523e3fe7001882a546?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFlight attendants also left bottles of water and sanitary wipes at the seats for passengers. Neither was given to those in economy.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607611bc3e3fe7001882a7f8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1316\" width=\"1755\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe rest of the aircraft's 162 seats are economy class in the standard 3-3 configuration.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a53d2cc1ef0018da16dc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe first eight rows of economy are what's known as \"premium class\" on Alaska.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5532cc1ef0018da16f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThese seats feature extra legroom, early boarding privileges, and complimentary alcohol. And until May 31, the middle seats in this section are kept open while the rest in economy may be filled.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5492cc1ef0018da16e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI was closer to the back for this flight in seat 25A, a window seat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54c3e3fe7001882a53e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere were still nine rows behind me, however, as this is one of the largest jets in Alaska's fleet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5472cc1ef0018da16e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPurple-ish mood lighting gave the cabin a relaxing futuristic feel, unlike anything I'd seen on other Max jets that use the dynamic lighting system.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a53b2cc1ef0018da16d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAt first, I was surprised by how big the backs of the seats seemed. But that was because they were chock full of amenities.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5433e3fe7001882a532?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tLocated in the seat-back are a full-size tray table, device holder, and two in-seat power options including a USB charging port...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5422cc1ef0018da16e2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd a 110v AC power outlet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54b2cc1ef0018da16ed?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe middle seat tray table also had two cup holders, ideal for when the middle seat is empty and its tray table can be used as a shared space for those in the aisle and window.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54b3e3fe7001882a53d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeat width is only around 17 inches, an inch less than United's offering on the 737 Max. Alternatively, seat pitch on Alaska's Boeing fleet is also around 31-32 inches.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5432cc1ef0018da16e4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://seatguru.com/airlines/Alaska_Airlines/information.php\">SeatGuru</a></em></p>\n\tLegroom wasn't an issue but I felt the seats were somewhat narrower from what I've experienced on other Max aircraft. Overall, though, it was a comfortable seat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5402cc1ef0018da16df?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAlaska doesn't offer seat-back screens on this aircraft, leaving passengers to their own devices for entertainment, literally. The Max fleet is also scheduled to offer WiFi but that won't be online for another few months, flight attendants informed us before departure.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5523e3fe7001882a545?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThat also meant no streaming content, which Alaska offers in-lieu of seat-back entertainment screens. Luckily, this was just a quick hop to Los Angeles and I had come prepared with downloaded movies and television shows.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5502cc1ef0018da16f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSafety cards clearly identified this aircraft as a Boeing 737 Max.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5433e3fe7001882a534?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAirlines have a different approach to the Max and safety cards. American Airlines and Southwest Airlines simply say \"737\" to conform with the rest of their Boeing 737 fleets.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a53c2cc1ef0018da16db?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><em>Read More: </em></strong><em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/flying-on-american-airlines-and-united-airlines-boeing-737-max-2021-3\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">I flew on Boeing 737 Max aircraft from United and American and found one airline to be a lot more transparent than the other &#8212; here's how the 2 compare</a></em></p>\n\tA quirky feature of flying on the Max is that life vests are located above passengers in a compartment above each row. Most aircraft have life vests under the seat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54c3e3fe7001882a53f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAs our departure time neared, it was time to head south to Los Angeles. And luckily, I had the middle seat open.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54a3e3fe7001882a53c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe took to the runway and departed south from Runway 16L. This is a route that Alaska flies multiple times per day so I felt confident that the pilots would know it like the back of their hands.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54f2cc1ef0018da16f0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe weather in Seattle was surprisingly fair and we didn't have too much trouble with turbulence.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54f3e3fe7001882a543?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAll in all, it was an incredibly smooth departure that settled into a similarly smooth flight as we said goodbye to Washington.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5512cc1ef0018da16f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI started up a movie on the device holder after takeoff. It really made for a better entertainment experience than having to hold my phone up and I didn't lose a percentage of charge thanks to the multiple power options.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60770f2874da0300181e1a12?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flying on Alaska Airlines during pandemic\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on Alaska Airlines during the pandemic\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFlight attendants came around shortly after takeoff to start the in-flight snack and drink service.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54e3e3fe7001882a540?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOn Alaska, that includes a choice of soft drink and a snack, as well as a sanitary wipe for good measure.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60770faa4206150018175730?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Flying on Alaska Airlines during pandemic\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on Alaska Airlines during the pandemic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOverall, the Max is a great product for Alaska that will represent it well moving forward.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5513e3fe7001882a544?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe onboard product is comparable to those in use with United and American, and I wouldn't hesitate to fly on the aircraft again, once the necessary fixes are made.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5432cc1ef0018da16e3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe rest of the flight was uneventful. We climbed to the dizzying heights of 37,000 feet and pretty much flew in a straight line towards Southern California.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5443e3fe7001882a535?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI had no doubts about the aircraft's capability at any time and truly enjoyed the flight, especially thanks to the quiet CFM International LEAP-1B engines.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a54f3e3fe7001882a541?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAlaska hasn't yet announced where the Max will fly after the West Coast but the aircraft's strengths suggest it will fly transcontinental routes and flights to Hawaii.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5453e3fe7001882a537?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt was truly a great day to fly and the Max performed beautifully.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a5963e3fe7001882a54c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Flying on an Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 Max 9 aircraft.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's unclear when Alaska's Max fleet will return to service but the grounding isn't likely to be as long as the prior 20-month grounding.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/605b9fff106eb50019d0573a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"PS Direct\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A BMV 750i of PS, the private terminal at Los Angeles International Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 96b.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a54f3e3fe7001882a543?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn41@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-03-038_6ad7337b4a3f550f.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a5512cc1ef0018da16f3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn61@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-01-351_7d8b44cb581ad2c3.webp","https://i.insider.com/60770f2874da0300181e1a12?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn28@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-00-844_97092258eb64e6f4.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a54e3e3fe7001882a540?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-57-714_19b6a626bcd6fc7e.webp","https://i.insider.com/60770faa4206150018175730?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn75@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-57-336_b6d82b0440ebb535.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a5513e3fe7001882a544?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn4@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-57-994_567792d31979560b.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a5432cc1ef0018da16e3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn95@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-56-641_725894a7da99b572.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a5443e3fe7001882a535?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn15@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-57-481_e9f3f4c057ac319d.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a54f3e3fe7001882a541?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn31@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-00-469_8dae861783b6a1b1.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a5453e3fe7001882a537?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn15@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-58-540_9b0adaf1aaad8e52.webp","https://i.insider.com/6075a5963e3fe7001882a54c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn52@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-01-785_f66afa95c87f88b5.webp","https://i.insider.com/605b9fff106eb50019d0573a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn93@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-890_c6835500cc75989a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=he9i_aiD_nk:-j5IL7WRg-E:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn48@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-56-532_c136f8b3f41d1302.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=he9i_aiD_nk:-j5IL7WRg-E:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-03-393_606576a58c3d8d0c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=he9i_aiD_nk:-j5IL7WRg-E:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn12@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-59-307_2e8c20e50229cb20.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/he9i_aiD_nk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn87@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-691_5a4f62a4dd7f0dc4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596269},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"French volunteers who lived in a cave with no phones, clocks, or sunlight for 40 days say it was 'great'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/france-group-spends-40-days-in-cave-with-no-clocks-or-sunlight-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60858abe3f0560001881be92?format=jpeg\" alt=\"french cave volunteers\" height=\"958\" width=\"1278\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Volunteers leave the Lombrives cave after spending 40 days in the cave in Ussat-les-Bains, southern of France, on April 24, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fred Scheiber/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>French volunteers have emerged from a cave after spending 40 days with no clocks or phones.</li>\n<li>They took part in the Deep Time project, which explored <strong>the limits of human isolation.</strong></li>\n<li>Two-thirds of the group say they wanted to stay in the cave for longer.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Insider&#39;s homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Fifteen volunteers have emerged from a cave in the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/france-denies-muslim-children-id-tags-2020-11\">southwest of France</a> after spending 40 days without clocks, phones, or sunlight for a human isolation experiment.</p><p>The group of eight men and seven women lived in the Lombrives cave as part of a $1.4 million project called <a href=\"https://deeptime.fr/en/\" data-link-name=\"in body link\">Deep Time</a>, which set out to explore the limits of human adaptability to isolation. The project, led by the Human Adaption Institute, ended on Saturday after 40 days.</p><p><a href=\"https://twitter.com/BFMTV/status/1385905147335872512/video/1\">Social media footage from the day</a> shows the smiling volunteers emerging from the cave to a round of applause while wearing special sunglasses to protect their eyes after so long in the dark. </p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/media-companies-plan-return-to-office-2021-4\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">Media companies including Bloomberg, The Washington Post, and ViacomCBS detail their return-to-office plans as workers push for flexibility after the pandemic</a></em></p><p>During their time in the cave, the volunteers slept in tents and made their own electricity with a pedal bike since there was no natural light. They also drew water from a well 146 ft below the earth.</p><p>Since there was no sunlight, the team had to follow their biological clocks to know when to sleep, eat, or do daily tasks.</p><p>To no one&#39;s surprise, they quickly lost their sense of time.</p><p>Project director Christian Clot, who was also part of the group, told reporters Saturday: &#34;And here we are! We just left after 40 days … For us, it was a real surprise,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/apr/25/deep-time-team-ends-40-days-underground-in-french-cave\">according to the Guardian.</a></p><p>One volunteer said they thought he had been underground for 23 days.</p><p><em><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60857c380da8f4001803353e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lombrives cave\" height=\"997\" width=\"1330\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The entrance of the Lombrives cave in Ussat, France.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Georges Gobet/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></em></p><p>The group had no communication with the outside world and was not able to use phones or other electronic devices.</p><p>One volunteer, math teacher Johan Francois, said he ran 6-mile circles in the cave to stay fit. He told reporters he had &#34;visceral urges&#34; to leave the cave, <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-56875801\">according to the BBC.</a></p><p>But other volunteers felt differently, with two-thirds saying they wanted to stay in the cave for longer.</p><p>&#34;For once in our lives, it was as if we could press pause,&#34; Marina Lançon, one of seven women to take part in the experiment, said, according to the Guardian. &#34;For once in our lives, we had time and could stop to live and do our tasks. It was great.&#34;</p><p>However, Lançon did admit to feeling happy to be outdoors and hear birdsong again.</p><p>French and Swiss scientists at the Human Adaption Institute monitored the volunteers closely during their time in the cave. They would regularly check the team&#39;s sleeping patterns, social interactions, and cognitive functions via sensors.</p><p>The volunteers&#39; brain activity was also collected before and after they entered the cave.</p><p>The scientists behind the project say it will help them understand how people can adapt to extreme living conditions and being in complete isolation.</p><p>&#34;Our future as humans on this planet will evolve,&#34; Clot said after emerging from the cave. &#34;We must learn to better understand how our brains are capable of finding new solutions, whatever the situation.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/france-group-spends-40-days-in-cave-with-no-clocks-or-sunlight-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=_7pk12RAPNM:s-qD4Zx8SAs:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60858abe3f0560001881be92?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0d45509d206fa8635238dc1cd5b23693","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn29@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-46-931_ef0eaea8089dcd94.webp","destWidth":1278,"destHeight":958,"sourceBytes":80994,"destBytes":80994,"author":"jkossoff@businessinsider.com (Julian Kossoff)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60858abe3f0560001881be92?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn29@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-46-931_ef0eaea8089dcd94.webp","https://i.insider.com/60857c380da8f4001803353e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn51@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-56-773_f0a1da89a7d2db5a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_7pk12RAPNM:s-qD4Zx8SAs:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn23@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-03-772_802112876385c107.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_7pk12RAPNM:s-qD4Zx8SAs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn11@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-56-220_6cb0597d9491f6b7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_7pk12RAPNM:s-qD4Zx8SAs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn63@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-56-832_f232f83c0d42a97e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_7pk12RAPNM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn33@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-01-949_d4d9244ba26bd108.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596239},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Here's why a jump in capital gains taxes doesn't spell the end for stock market gains, according to the world's largest wealth manager","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-sp500-capital-gains-tax-biden-congress-assets-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb161e11441925c0e5d7bca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Traders NYSE green\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lucas Jackson/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Stocks are able to show positive returns even with higher capital gains taxes, said UBS Global Wealth Management. </li>\n<li>President Joe Biden may propose nearly doubling the tax rate to 39.6% on profit made from asset sales. </li>\n<li>LPL Financial said stock performance after a capital gains tax hike is a &#34;mixed bag&#34; that may be tied to economic conditions. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<br><br>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Stocks can still thrive even if the US raises the capital gains tax, according to UBS Global Wealth Management.</p><p>A report by <a href=\"https://news.bloombergtax.com/daily-tax-report-state/biden-to-propose-capital-gains-tax-as-high-as-43-4-for-wealthy\">Bloomberg on Thursday</a> saying President Joe Biden is considering proposing a near doubling in the capital gains tax rate ignited a selloff on stocks, knocking the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones\">Dow Jones Industrial Average</a> down by <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-dow-biden-capital-gains-tax-selloff-2021-4-1030335348\">about 320 points</a>.</p><p>Biden is reportedly seeking a capital gains tax rate of 39.6% for Americans who earn more than $1 million. That rate would be added to the 3.8% tax on net investment income that&#39;s tied to Obamacare, which would bring the proposed tax rate to 43.4%. The current capital gains tax now stands at 20%. </p><p>If it transpires, the proposal &#34;breaks new ground&#34; in terms of taxation of investment income, which tends to be treated more favorably than ordinary income, said UBS in a Friday note. It said its base case foresees a capital gains tax rate of 28% following negotiations with Congress.</p><p>&#34;While we can&#39;t rule out some additional modest equity market volatility as investors react to this proposal, we think it will be very short-lived,&#34; said Mark Haefele, chief investment officer at UBS Global Wealth Management, in the research note. </p><p>He said the last time capital gains taxes went up was in 2013 when they rose by nearly 9 percentage points.</p><p>&#34;Yet stocks rose 30% that year. In addition, we find no correlation between capital gains tax rates and equity market valuations,&#34; said Haefele.</p><p>The capital gains tax on top earners was raised to 20% from 15% but including the Obamacare sur-tax, the rate went up to 23.8%.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-buy-amid-us-economic-deceleration-global-boom-gs-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GOLDMAN SACHS: Buy these 45 &#39;global-facing&#39; stocks set to benefit from the worldwide growth boom as the pace in the US begins to slow</a></em></p><p>Haefele said price-to-earnings multiples have been as low as 10 times when the capital gains tax rate was 20%, and as high as 18 times when it was 35%. &#34;Ultimately, other factors such as the outlook for economic growth, monetary policy, and interest rates are much more powerful drivers of equity market returns and valuations.&#34;</p><p>There are still questions about the potentially higher tax, including if it&#39;s retroactive or if it would start early in 2022, Ryan Detrick, chief market strategist at LPL Financial, said in a Friday note.</p><p>&#34;If it is in 2022, people have some massive gains they might want to book now instead of later,&#34; he said, adding that the rate doesn&#39;t appear headed to 39.6% &#34;as the Democrats are likely starting high and there will be some back and forth as the sausage is made.&#34; <br><br>Detrick said stocks &#34;did really well&#34; for the next six months after increases in capital gains tax rates in 2013 and 1987. His note displayed a table showing <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\">S&#38;P 500 index</a> returns, and there was a 24% gain in 1987 six months after the tax climbed to 28% from 20%. <br><br>&#34;Of course, stocks did poorly after the hikes of 1969 and 1976, so we have a mixed bag,&#34; said Detrick. In the six months after tax hikes, S&#38;P 500 returns fell 20.4% in 1969 and dropped 5.6% in 1976. <br><br>&#34;But could it be as simple as those times weren&#39;t the best for the economy, while in 1987 and 2013 the economy was healthy?&#34; For now, we&#39;d side with an improving economy and accommodative Fed will take the higher coming taxes in stride,&#34; said Detrick.</p><p>UBS&#39; Hafele said many families will not be subject to the proposed higher levy. He also said deferral of  capital gains taxes to years where taxable income is below the proposed $1 million threshold could allow subjected taxpayers to continue paying the current long-term capital gains tax rate of 23.8%. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Mozée)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5eb161e11441925c0e5d7bca?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn84@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-55-395_7438ff094ce158ea.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=nXgrR59m2L8:3LI0i7Zgy_Y:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn7@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-56-216_0513ecc150a499dd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=nXgrR59m2L8:3LI0i7Zgy_Y:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-55-567_44dfed938c9d2091.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=nXgrR59m2L8:3LI0i7Zgy_Y:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn10@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-03-005_e5750bd7175463f5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/nXgrR59m2L8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn59@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-03-831_c7509c65d7d39848.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596239},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"China plans to land its Chang'e 6 lunar lander by 2024. An asteroid defense system could also be on the way.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-in-space-asteroid-defence-moon-mission-mars-rover-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60855a753f0560001881be7a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"AP21114175118735\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>China&#39;s Tianwen-1 probe en route to Mars.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>China is aiming to launch its moon lander in 2024. It will carry kit developed by global scientists.</li>\n<li>The robot is expected to land near the lunar south pole and collect samples to bring back to Earth.</li>\n<li>A system to protect against near-Earth asteroids may also be in the works. </li>\n</ul>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>China plans to launch its next robot lunar lander in 2024, and it will carry equipment manufactured by scientists from France, Sweden, Italy, and Russia, Hu Hao, the program&#39;s chief designer, told the <a href=\"http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2021-04/24/c_139903600.htm\">Xinhua News Agency</a> on Saturday.</p><p>The country aims to position the lander, named Chang&#39;e 6, near the lunar south pole where it will collect samples, <a href=\"http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2021-04/24/c_139903600.htm\">per the official news agency. </a></p><p>The Chang&#39;e 6 lander is part of China&#39;s ongoing mission to successfully return moon samples back home &#34;for comprehensive analysis and research,&#34; Hu said at a conference, <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/russia-italy-moon-space-exploration-china-b3d7f0fdb349b8fd769d8fac2d2401ce\">Associated Press reported.</a></p><p>For the 2024 mission, The China National Space Administration has invited scientists from around the world to take part in the program, offering to transport solicited payloads into space. So far, four payloads designed by the international scientists have been preliminarily chosen, the<a href=\"http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2021-04/24/c_139903600.htm\"> Xinhua News Agency reported</a>. </p><p>Apart from the moon lander, the country&#39;s exploration efforts could also include an asteroid defense system, although details are scarce, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/science/china-consider-building-an-asteroids-defence-system-2021-04-24/\">Reuters reported</a>. </p><p>According to scientists from around the world, asteroid impacts with Earth have caused mass-extinction events such as the death of dinosaurs. But China isn&#39;t the only country concerned about asteroid impacts. <a href=\"https://www.slashgear.com/china-may-build-an-asteroid-defense-system-24670261/\">According to SlashGear</a>, NASA and other space agencies have also paid close attention to planet-protection programs. </p><p>Meanwhile, a Mars rover named Zhu Rong, after a mythical god of fire and war, is already en route to the Red Planet aboard the Tianwen-1 probe. According to a Chinese legend, the mythical god symbolically carries a legacy of defense, <a href=\"https://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3130918/china-names-its-mars-rover-zhu-rong-after-mythical-god-war\">South China Morning Post reported.</a></p><p>&#34;Zhu Rong is revered as the earliest god of fire in traditional Chinese culture, symbolising the use of fire to illuminate the earth and bring light,&#34; the space administration said in a statement on Saturday. </p><div height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 25 Apr 2021 12:28:21 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60855a753f0560001881be7a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"8f39628a5826b5147a07457b9f2621d1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn6@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-36-696_b67c412929e80792.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1500,"sourceBytes":80198,"destBytes":80198,"author":"ztayeb@businessinsider.com (Zahra Tayeb)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60855a753f0560001881be7a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn6@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-36-696_b67c412929e80792.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=y-_PmDI0tL4:vql2JITBcIk:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn85@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-02-225_81dda8cef1b71089.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=y-_PmDI0tL4:vql2JITBcIk:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn27@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-56-736_9fd48e88b08e9b92.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=y-_PmDI0tL4:vql2JITBcIk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn43@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-57-525_ed49bffbd0f47093.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/y-_PmDI0tL4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn53@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-54-917_19f5af1efe9af8ef.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596220},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Real-estate agents are finding success by turning to TikTok: 'It doesn't seem to matter if the place is $2,000 or $600,000'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/real-estate-agents-on-tiktok-advertise-rental-listings-virtual-showings-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081d1dc1041d50019f2db49?format=jpeg\" alt=\"brooklyn real estate better than manhattan 2x1\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Skye Gould/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Real-estate agents and brands alike are leveraging TikTok for sales and rentals amid the pandemic.</li>\n<li>Insider spoke to real-estate agents about how the platform has changed their business.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In the wake of the pandemic forcing their business online, some real-estate agents took to an unlikely platform - TikTok. </p><p><a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@cash.jordan?lang=en\">Cash Jordan</a>, a New York City-based agent, has over 600,000 followers on the platform and 14.2 million likes. In the past year, he&#39;s shown million-dollar townhomes and $2,500 two-bedrooms, and he says his only regret about TikTok is that he didn&#39;t get on the platform sooner. </p><p>As the pandemic pushed realtors into the digital space, some of them adapted into TikTok&#39;s signature short-form video format. Jordan says that the real-estate market, &#34;this dinosaur of an industry,&#34; had to adapt and go online. And TikTok, despite its reputation as an app for teenagers, has been a boon to business.</p><p>After New York City shut down, Jordan began posting videos across platforms like TikTok, YouTube, and Instagram, and saw a huge response. </p><p>&#34;It doesn&#39;t seem to matter if the place is $2,000 or $600,000, somebody out there on TikTok is big enough and YouTube is big enough that people see it and are interested,&#34; Jordan said.</p><p>Jordan estimated using TikTok had doubled his number of clients.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><blockquote class=\"tiktok-embed\" cite=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@cash.jordan/video/6952150810922945798\" data-video-id=\"6952150810922945798\" style=\"max-width: 605px;min-width: 325px;\"> <section> <a target=\"_blank\" title=\"@cash.jordan\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@cash.jordan\">@cash.jordan</a> <p>Cheap Apartment!  <a title=\"nycapartment\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/nycapartment\">##nycapartment</a> <a title=\"nycapartmentcheck\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/nycapartmentcheck\">##nycapartmentcheck</a> <a title=\"apartmenttour\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/apartmenttour\">##apartmenttour</a> <a title=\"nycapartmenthunting\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/nycapartmenthunting\">##nycapartmenthunting</a> <a title=\"mycrib\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/mycrib\">##mycrib</a></p> <a target=\"_blank\" title=\"♬ original sound - Cash Jordan\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/music/original-sound-6952150708015745798\">♬ original sound - Cash Jordan</a> </section> </blockquote> <script async=\"\" src=\"https://www.tiktok.com/embed.js\"></script></div><p>Similarly, <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@thenycagent?lang=en\">Madison Sutton</a>, who posts on TikTok as @thenycagent, has 95,700 followers and has amassed 1.5 million total likes across her videos. Sutton, who works for Highline, found herself concerned about the safety and efficiency of in-person showings. So in October of last year, she turned to TikTok. &#34;Where else in New York City can you see ten apartments in ten minutes?&#34; she asked.</p><p>Sutton, like Jordan, focuses primarily on rentals, and she says business is &#34;five or six times heavier&#34; compared to this time last year. Jordan films and edits his videos himself, and Sutton either uses POV shots or enlists her mother for help with filming. The videos are part apartment tour, part conversation. And it&#39;s intentional: agents like Sutton and Jordan are looking to forge a connection with viewers.</p><p>Jordan told Insider about a client who&#39;d been deciding between an apartment listed by his brokerage and another apartment from a competitor - practically identical listings. Her parents got in touch afterwards and said they&#39;d gone with Jordan&#39;s listing because, after watching his videos, it felt like they knew him. </p><p>Sutton agrees. Part of her strategy is giving &#34;general New York tips&#34; - outfit ideas, or tips about different neighborhoods. &#34;It makes the process a lot less scary,&#34; she said.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><blockquote class=\"tiktok-embed\" cite=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@thenycagent/video/6953014768882011398\" data-video-id=\"6953014768882011398\" style=\"max-width: 605px;min-width: 325px;\"> <section> <a target=\"_blank\" title=\"@thenycagent\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@thenycagent\">@thenycagent</a> <p>Reply to @deceased  I want to move to NYC, when should I look? <a title=\"nyc\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/nyc\">##nyc</a> <a title=\"nycfood\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/nycfood\">##nycfood</a></p> <a target=\"_blank\" title=\"♬ original sound - Madison Raye Sutton\" href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/music/original-sound-6953014618293897990\">♬ original sound - Madison Raye Sutton</a> </section> </blockquote> <script async=\"\" src=\"https://www.tiktok.com/embed.js\"></script></div><p> </p><p>And it&#39;s not just individual agents amassing major followings. In February, Corcoran partnered with the app for a branded challenge, with agents posting videos of themselves in their homes or properties they were selling, all set to a specific song. The legacy brand then reposted some of the TikTok videos onto <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@corcorangroup?lang=en\">its own account</a>, which just passed 20,000 followers and 200,000 total likes. Sydney Perry, director of digital content at Corcoran, told Insider that the brand is &#34;really trying to go global with our TikTok content&#34; as Corcoran expands globally.</p><p>Perry also said that TikTok is unique among social media platforms for the way content reaches people and potentially goes viral. Due to the site&#39;s algorithmic &#34;For You Page,&#34; she explained, &#34;You don&#39;t need to have a massive following in order for your videos to go viral and to be seen by hundreds of thousands of people.&#34; Instead, content from new accounts appears in users&#39; feeds automatically based on their previous interests.</p><p>Sutton noted TikTok&#39;s unique interface as part of the reason for her success on the platform as well. Since TikTok videos can be posted to other social media platforms and viewed in web browsers, without users having to download the app like they might with an Instagram video, TikTok content is inherently shareable, even for people who don&#39;t spend their days scrolling through it. </p><p>But one of the reasons these agents spend so much time on TikTok, Sutton and Jordan said, is that they enjoy it.</p><p>&#34;It&#39;s a good thing people want to watch these videos,&#34; Jordan told Insider. &#34;Because I&#39;m addicted to making them.&#34; </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the class=\"copyright\">ABC</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>\n<p><strong>Every week, the streaming search engine Reelgood compiles for Insider a list of the TV shows that have been most prominent on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-netflix-tips-and-tricks\" data-site=\"bi\" data-keyword=\"Netflix\" data-analytics-product-module=\"Auto-Linker\" lists.</strong></p>\n<section data-slideshow-intro-content=\"\">\n<section data-slideshow-intro-content=\"\">\n<section data-slideshow-intro-content=\"\"></section>\n</section>\n</section>\n</li>\n<li>The reality series &#34;The Circle&#34; returned this month and was one of Netflix&#39;s most popular shows this week. But it couldn&#39;t top ABC&#39;s short-lived comedy series &#34;The Baker and the Beauty.&#34;</li>\n<li>Netflix counts a view if an account watches a movie or TV show for at least two minutes.\n<section data-slideshow-intro-content=\"\">\n<section data-slideshow-intro-content=\"\">\n<section data-slideshow-intro-content=\"\"></section>\n</section>\n</section>\n</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"f0e80ded5d35b2778c5da3bdda2e6898\">Visit the business section of Insider for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t9. \"This Is a Robbery: The World's Biggest Art Heist\" (Netflix original, 2021)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070b9e7a451820019b3a614?format=jpeg\" alt=\"this is robbery netflix\" height=\"1048\" width=\"1474\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81032570\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"5a2ee8918fdcfa038d15af2d8304d10f\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"In 1990, two men dressed as cops con their way into a Boston museum and steal a fortune in art. Take a deep dive into this daring and notorious crime.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 86%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"Filmmakers and brothers Colin and Nick Barnicle demonstrate a keen eye for dramatic storytelling from the very start.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://chicago.suntimes.com/2021/4/6/22368326/this-is-a-robbery-review-huge-art-heist-dazzling-netflix-true-crime-treatment\">Chicago Sun-Times</a></p>\n\t8. \"Ginny and Georgia\" (Netflix original, 2021-present)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/604bc71810c8760018b9301c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ginny and georgia\" height=\"1257\" width=\"1676\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81025696\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"8f19b3896a9fc7a2f9d0c62f2381c430\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"Free-spirited Georgia and her two kids, Ginny and Austin, move north in search of a fresh start but find that the road to new beginnings can be bumpy.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 68%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"Lampert, Fisher, and company are at their best when writing for Ginny, and Gentry doesn't miss a beat.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.rogerebert.com/streaming/netflixs-ginny-and-georgia-never-finds-its-own-identity\">RogerEbert.com</a> (season one)</p>\n\t7. \"The Serpent\" (Netflix original, 2021)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60831a661041d50019f2dff7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the serpent netflix\" height=\"997\" width=\"1330\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/80206099\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"9d640cc4a0e3daed0bbbc0fe0a70366f\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"In the 1970s, merciless killer Charles Sobhraj preys on travelers exploring the \"hippie trail\" of South Asia. Based on shocking true events.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 68%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"The show takes advantage of the opportunity to reframe some of those key moments from a different character's viewpoint, something that would be odd or forced in a more straightforward telling.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.indiewire.com/2021/04/the-serpent-netflix-review-tahar-rahim-1234627669/\">Indiewire</a></p>\n\t6. \"Who Killed Sara?\" (Netflix original, 2021-present)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070c154a451820019b3a645?format=jpeg\" alt=\"who killed sara netflix\" height=\"940\" width=\"1270\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81166747?source=35\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"0d5060e253d8a5543caeb0b5c5123545\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"Hell-bent on exacting revenge and proving he was framed for his sister's murder, &#193;lex sets out to unearth much more than the crime's real culprit.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 86%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"Has a few logic problems, but its overall vibe is energetic enough, with good performances, to keep viewers' attention.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://decider.com/2021/03/24/who-killed-sara-netflix-review/\">Decider</a> (season one)</p>\n\t5. \"Nicky, Ricky, Dicky and Dawn\" (Nickelodeon, 2014-2018)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60831af44becb800190f6e97?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nicky, ricky, dicky and dawn\" height=\"919\" width=\"1225\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nickelodeon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/80077508\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"047235780ea7fe86545514eca988ddd7\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"Just because they're quadruplets, that doesn't mean these 10-year-olds always get along. But for all the bickering, they're loyal to the last.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: N/A</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: N/A</p>\n\t4. \"Cocomelon\" (YouTube, 2019-present)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60831b2d1041d50019f2dfff?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cocomelon\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1601\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81273085\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"14b6d0b414f721b49b2904a58f207c56\">Description</a>:</strong>&#160;\"Learn letters, numbers, animal sounds and more with J.J. in this musical series that brings fun times with nursery rhymes for the whole family!\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: N/A</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: N/A</p>\n\t3. \"Dad Stop Embarrassing Me!\" (Netflix original, 2021-present)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60831b911041d50019f2e005?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dad stop embarrassing me netflix\" height=\"1110\" width=\"1370\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81026218\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"A single dad and cosmetics brand owner figures out fatherhood on the fly when his strong-minded teen daughter moves in with him.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 18%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"Brian and Sasha take turns talking to the camera, sharing their perspectives with the viewer, but DSEM! never doesn't feel like The Jamie Foxx Show 2, with the showboating actor sucking up all the energy in the room.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/dad-stop-embarrassing-me-tv-review\">Hollywood Reporter</a> (season two)</p>\n\t2. \"The Circle\" (Netflix original, 2020-present)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60831ca71041d50019f2e00b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the circle netflix\" height=\"907\" width=\"1210\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Netflix</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81044551\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"Status and strategy collide in this social experiment and competition show where online players flirt, befriend and catfish their way toward $100,000.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 81%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"The flattening confusion of social media can make this setup into a game, but it's hardly a show. It's a bunch of reality TV players in search of a drama.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://slate.com/culture/2020/01/netflixs-the-circle-is-a-fascinating-reality-competition-i-cant-bear-to-watch.html\">Slate</a> (season one)</p>\n\t1. \"The Baker and the Beauty\" (ABC, 2020)\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60831e521041d50019f2e010?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the baker and the beauty\" height=\"1132\" width=\"1430\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">ABC</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/title/81267239\"><strong>Description</strong></a>: \"A Miami baker and a fashionista try to make romance work despite the heat they face from jealous exes, prying family members and invasive paparazzi.\"</p><p><strong>Rotten Tomatoes critic score</strong>: 88%</p><p><strong>What critics said</strong>: \"It's all done with charm and a relatively light touch. There are enough credible reasons why this pair might actually click.\" &#8212; <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/tv/reviews/baker-and-the-beauty-abc-1234572235/\">Variety</a> (season one)</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/top-shows-netflix-this-week-circle-baker-and-the-beauty-2021-4'>Business ebp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZuKAaa3VnF8:0n-EYBz0Ko0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-57-128_1cf6b00ad7c5cd5e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZuKAaa3VnF8:0n-EYBz0Ko0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn68@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-59-487_60410efe06433ac9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ZuKAaa3VnF8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-59-612_b485a3e33fb8d16b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596263},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Joe Manchin says he's 'not a roadblock' to Biden's agenda but won't be a part of 'blowing up' the Senate","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-manchin-not-a-roadblock-to-biden-agenda-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608585cc0da8f40018033549?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joe Manchin\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sen. Joe Manchin, D-W.Va., speaks during a Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources hearing on the nomination of Rep. Debra Haaland, D-N.M., to be Secretary of the Interior on Capitol Hill in Washington.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Leigh Vogel/Pool via AP, File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>West Virginia Sen. Joe Manchin said he&#39;s &#34;not a roadblock&#34; to Biden&#39;s agenda.</li>\n<li>Manchin, a Democrat, has opposed some of Biden&#39;s policy proposals, including his hike of the corporate tax rate.</li>\n<li>Manchin has also said he will refuse to weaken or eliminate the filibuster.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>West Virginia Sen. Joe Manchin, a Democrat, on Sunday said he didn&#39;t believe he was a &#34;roadblock&#34; to President Joe Biden, despite his opposition to parts of the president&#39;s agenda, including his<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-2-trillion-infrastructure-plan-roads-bridges-broadband-power-2021-3\"> infrastructure plan</a>.</p><p>&#34;I&#39;m not a roadblock at all. The best politics is good government,&#34; Manchin said Sunday during an appearance on <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/25/politics/joe-manchin-joe-biden-infrastructure-bill-cnntv/index.html\">CNN&#39;s &#34;State of the Union&#34; with Dana Bash</a>.</p><p>Machin said he doesn&#39;t believe legislation should just be pushed through by those in power without debate or bipartisan discussion. </p><p>&#34;We won&#39;t give this system a chance to work,&#34; Manchin said. &#34;I&#39;m not going to be part of blowing up this Senate of ours, or basically this democracy of ours, or the republic that we have.&#34; </p><p>Manchin and Arizona Sen. Krysten Simena, also a Democrat, were <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/graham-praises-manchin-and-sinema-for-protecting-filibuster-2021-4\">praised last week by South Carolina Sen. Lindsay Graham</a>, a Republican, for their opposition to eliminating the filibuster in the Senate.</p><p>&#34;The House wasn&#39;t designed to be partisan. The House was designed to be hot as a cracker,&#34; Manchin added. &#34;We were designed to cool it off.&#34;</p><p>Democrats and Republicans hold an even 50-50 split in the Senate, but Vice President Kamala Harris serves as the tie-breaking vote, giving Democrats a slight lead. But Republicans can still torpedo any legislation they dislike by using the filibuster, which requires 60 votes to bring a debate to an end.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-State of the Union  (@CNNSotu) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1386320649283637248?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 25, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p> </p><p>In an <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/joe-manchin-filibuster-vote/2021/04/07/cdbd53c6-97da-11eb-a6d0-13d207aadb78_story.html\">April 7 op-ed in the Washington Post</a>, Manchin said he would not vote to eliminate or weaken the filibuster, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/democratic-sen-manchin-opposed-to-removing-filibuster-2021-3\">reaffirming his previous position</a>.</p><p>&#34;There is no circumstance in which I will vote to eliminate or weaken the filibuster,&#34; he wrote. &#34;The time has come to end these political games, and to usher a new era of bipartisanship where we find common ground on the major policy debates facing our nation.&#34;</p><p>Manchin <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/manchin-poses-threat-to-progressives-plan-to-raise-the-minimum-wage\">was also one of eight Democrats who voted against</a> Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders&#39; proposal that would&#39;ve raised the federal minimum wage to $15. All Democrats in the Senate would&#39;ve needed to vote in favor of the proposal for it to have passed.  </p><p>Earlier in April, Manchin said he <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/04/05/joe-manchin-white-house-tax/\">opposed some of Biden&#39;s $2 trillion infrastructure plan</a>, specifically his proposal to raise the corporate tax rate from 21% to 28%. Manchin said he believed the tax should be set in between at 25%.</p><p>&#34;The bill, basically, is not going to end up that way,&#34; Manchin said during an appearance on a West Virginia radio station. &#34;If I don&#39;t vote to get on it, it&#39;s not going anywhere. So we&#39;re going to have some leverage here.&#34;</p><p>Manchin on Sunday told CNN he would support a smaller bill with a &#34;more targeted&#34; approach to infrastructure. </p><p>&#34;Why can&#39;t we try to make this work?&#34; he asked. &#34;If you have the violent swings every time you have a party change, then we will have no consistency whatsoever.&#34; </p><div
