01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"NASA's former Mars leader says the agency is 'keeping their eye' on a crewed mission to the Red Planet","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/former-nasa-mars-leader-scott-hubbard-crewed-mars-mission-horizon-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/602930dc2edd0f001a8d5bbc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mars from UAE Hope Probe.JPG\" height=\"3029\" width=\"3899\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A photo of Mars taken by the United Arab Emirates Space Agency.\n<p class=\"copyright\">United Arab Emirates Space Agency/Mohammed bin Rashid Space Centre/LASP/EMM-EXI/Handout via REUTERS.</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>NASA said its return to the moon would be a step toward a crewed Mars mission.</li>\n<li>&#34;It&#39;s something I hoped I would see,&#34; said Scott Hubbard, a former Mars program leader. </li>\n<li>NASA last week flew a helicopter and produced oxygen on Mars, good signals for future missions. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>When NASA <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spacex-elon-musk-nasa-lunar-landing-astronauts-2021-4\">announced its partnership</a> with SpaceX to return to the moon by 2024, Scott Hubbard, who formerly led the agency&#39;s Mars program, was hoping there would be some news about future crewed trips to the Red Planet. </p><p>He wasn&#39;t disappointed. The <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/as-artemis-moves-forward-nasa-picks-spacex-to-land-next-americans-on-moon\">press release</a> from NASA mentioned Mars a few times, positioning the trip to the moon as an important step toward an eventual Mars mission.</p><p>&#34;It&#39;s something I hoped I would see,&#34; Hubbard, who is also a SpaceX advisor, said in a phone interview on Thursday. &#34;So that it&#39;s clear ... that they&#39;re keeping their eye on the Mars goal and working toward it in this interim fashion.&#34;</p><p>NASA&#39;s announcement about the moon mission came amid a flood of news about Mars, where the agency landed its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mars-landing-nasa-perseverance-rover-touches-down-in-jezero-crater-2021-2\">Perseverance rover</a> earlier this year.</p><p>On Monday, NASA&#39;s Ingenuity helicopter made history with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-flies-on-mars-2021-4\">the first powered, controlled flight</a> on another planet. The same helicopter later <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-perseverance-rover-moxie-device-turns-carbon-dioxide-into-oxygen-2021-4\">converted</a> carbon dioxide into oxygen for the first time. Both events were seen as small steps toward a crewed trip to the Red Planet. </p><p>Elon Musk, the founder of SpaceX, has often said he wanted to get people to Mars as soon as possible. He expected to have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-plans-1-million-people-to-mars-by-2050-2020-1\">1 million people</a> on Mars by 2050, he said last year.</p><p>This year, he said he was confident the first crewed mission would happen in 2026 but <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-spacex-starship-humans-mars-mission-2026-experts-question-2021-2\">some experts expressed skepticism</a>. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-starship-land-humans-on-moon-by-2024-2021-4\">At a press briefing</a> on Friday, Musk said the first trip could be in &#34;a couple years.&#34;</p><p>Moving quickly in space exploration brings with it a great risk. Musk seemed to acknowledge this, saying at another event this week that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-mars-announcing-100-million-xprize-carbon-contest-2021-4\">&#34;a bunch of people will probably die&#34;</a> as crews venture toward the Red Planet. This would be similar to any prior danger associated with exploration, he added. </p><p>NASA is taking incremental steps, said Hubbard. First, the agency&#39;s going to learn to live and work on the moon. Setting up a permanent base on the moon will be a learning experience, which will help when crews eventually land on Mars.</p><p>It takes about three days to get to the moon but about seven months to get to the Red Planet. Hubbard said he was enthusiastic about Mars, but also wanted astronauts to be able to return to Earth. </p><p>&#34;There&#39;s been talk about one-way trips,&#34; Hubbard said with a laugh. &#34;I&#39;m not a fan of that, but some people are.&#34; </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2021 14:43:22 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/602930e22edd0f001a8d5bbd?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"826fa385e89e84361521a3d2c647fb9a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn36@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-54-469_31aa6a9a771a042a.webp","destWidth":3899,"destHeight":2924,"sourceBytes":52760,"destBytes":52760,"author":"kshalvey@businessinsider.com (Kevin Shalvey)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/602930dc2edd0f001a8d5bbc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn7@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-56-985_b3982f5e17f0a898.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XWbIb50kBvQ:tZQ9eeg1pW8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn64@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-59-864_9f36cadf0316812c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XWbIb50kBvQ:tZQ9eeg1pW8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn46@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-707_178cf472ecc15304.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=XWbIb50kBvQ:tZQ9eeg1pW8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn72@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-59-520_0952ca44df92b295.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/XWbIb50kBvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn53@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-01-301_99fcc26021dfbad6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596230},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Sen. Lindsey Graham says systemic racism doesn't exist in the United States","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/lindsey-graham-systemic-racism-doesnt-exist-in-us-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fff2731fe7e140019f7eb22?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages lindsey graham\" height=\"3617\" width=\"5423\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) speaks during a news conference at the U.S. Capitol January 7, 2021 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>In an interview on &#34;Fox News Sunday,&#34; Sen. Lindsey Graham said systemic racism does not exist in the US.</li>\n<li>&#34;The vice president is of African American-Indian descent,&#34; he said. &#34;So our systems are not racist.&#34;</li>\n<li>Systemic racism is known to benefit white people across American institutions like law enforcement and education.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Sen. Lindsey Graham of South Carolina on Sunday denied that systemic racism exists in the United States.</p><p>Asked by Fox News&#39; Chris Wallace whether systemic racism exists across American institutions, Graham said no. </p><p>&#34;Not in my opinion. We just elected a two-term African-American president,&#34; he said, referring to former President Barack Obama, who was in office from January 2009 to January 2017.</p><p>&#34;The vice president is of African American-Indian descent,&#34; he continued, referring to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kamala-harris-makes-history-first-woman-black-vice-president-elect-2020-11\">Kamala Harris</a>. &#34;So our systems are not racist. America&#39;s not a racist country.&#34;</p><p>Extensive research and data illustrate how systemic racism in the United States makes basic experiences like banking, education, and interactions with law enforcement <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-systemic-racism-in-charts-graphs-data-2020-6\">vastly different for people of color</a> compared to white people. </p><p>Wallace asked Graham about systemic racism specifically within policing, which Graham also denied. </p><p>&#34;Within every society, you have bad actors. The Chauvin trial was a just result,&#34; he said on &#34;Fox News Sunday.&#34; </p><p>The trial of Derek Chauvin, a former Minneapolis police officer who knelt on George Floyd&#39;s neck for more than nine minutes, just ended in his conviction.</p><p>Floyd died on May 25 during an arrest, and video shows that he repeatedly said <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/police-body-camera-footage-reveals-george-floyds-death-2020-7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">he could not breathe</a> while trapped under Chauvin&#39;s weight. </p><p>Chauvin faces up to 40 years in prison for the second-degree murder charge. He also faces up to 25 years for the third-degree murder charge and up to 10 years for second-degree manslaughter. Because Chauvin was convicted of all charges, he will be <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/derek-chauvin-verdict-george-floyd-death-2021-4\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">sentenced on the top charge of second-degree murder</a>. His sentencing is scheduled for <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/derek-chauvin-sentencing-murder-george-floyd-scheduled-june-2021-4\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">June</a>. </p><p>This is not the first time Graham has made controversial remarks about racism and people of color. </p><p>Last October, Graham said Black people are safe in South Carolina <strong>- </strong>but <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/graham-black-people-go-anywhere-in-south-carolina-if-conservative-2020-10\">only if they are not liberal</a>. </p><p>&#34;I care about everybody,&#34; Graham said, speaking at a forum for South Carolina Senate candidates. &#34;If you&#39;re a young African American, an immigrant, you can go anywhere in this state. You just need to be conservative, not liberal.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/lindsey-graham-systemic-racism-doesnt-exist-in-us-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 2021 15:17:58 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fff2738fe7e140019f7eb23?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"215eaeb7e600c6bd081c58ee21997ec1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn3@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-54-557_6004364d9bc5c1c1.webp","destWidth":4822,"destHeight":3616,"sourceBytes":433124,"destBytes":433124,"author":"ydzhanova@businessinsider.com (Yelena Dzhanova)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fff2731fe7e140019f7eb22?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn71@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-00-195_aa4b8c858cb817b7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=S2RV_8lXtsc:BK-fl7mM7-M:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn44@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-55-168_f6f886744a26bcd9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=S2RV_8lXtsc:BK-fl7mM7-M:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn39@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-57-155_d6b354fbf94a88a9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=S2RV_8lXtsc:BK-fl7mM7-M:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn48@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-55-708_549823e4aaecefea.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/S2RV_8lXtsc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn23@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-55-092_820741447c2298d0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596239},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"I flew on the Cirrus Vision Jet and saw how the world's cheapest private jet is enabling a new era of less-expensive private travel","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/flying-on-verijet-cirrus-vision-jet-most-affordable-charter-jet-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081e09d4becb800190f6a71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1522\" width=\"2029\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>VeriJet is the first charter airline to use the Cirrus Vision Jet as its flagship aircraft. </li>\n<li>The single-engine jet can seat four adults and fly a range of nearly 1,300 nautical miles. </li>\n<li>Its safety features include a parachute, autoland, and a modern cockpit that reduces pilot workload. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe Cirrus Vision Jet is the flagship of VeriJet, one of America's newest charter airlines offering affordable air taxi-like service using efficient jet aircraft.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd571041d50019f2db87?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em><strong>Read More:</strong>&#160;</em><em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/verijet-offering-affordable-charter-flights-with-the-cirrus-vision-jet-2021-4\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">A new charter airline is offering flights with one of the world's most popular and affordable private jets</a></em></p>\n\tIt's designed to be a \"personal private jet,\" flown by a single pilot that wants all the perks of a jet but not the high operating costs.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608077dfc36a8a00185c63ae?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_3467\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut its low costs also make it ideal for charter operations. VeriJet only charges a $3,000 hourly rate, well below the retail rate for larger aircraft.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60832ff008610f0018b0f3b5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1779\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tDriving down costs is the fact that the jet only has one engine instead of two. But even with one engine, the Vision Jet can fly distances of around 1,300 nautical miles at speeds of over 300 knots.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd611041d50019f2db95?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://cirrusaircraft.com/aircraft/vision-jet/\">Cirrus Aircraft Company</a></em></p>\n\tI took a ride in VeriJet's Vision Jet with founder Richard Kane to see just how well this personal private jet was worth the price of a private charter. Here's what it was like.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080766f4becb800190f6552?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn VeriJet's configuration, the Vision Jet can seat four adults and two children. Its cabin resembles that of a luxury car more so than it does a traditional private jet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080766f4becb800190f6553?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe design is utilitarian but the seats are comfortable leather and the curved shape of the fuselage allows for more headspace.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd681041d50019f2db9e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe benefit of flying with only one pilot is that the co-pilot seat becomes a passenger seat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd584becb800190f6a3e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIf a trip requires two pilots, the aircraft's capacity down to three adults. Around 30% of trips have passengers that prefer to fly with two pilots as a layer of protection even though the Vision Jet is a single-pilot plane.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd674becb800190f6a50?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA feature of the aircraft that Kane says is one that passengers love the most is its oversized windows that increase visibility and brighten up the cabin.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd651041d50019f2db9a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn the flight deck, the cockpit consists of two large displays accompanied by a smaller panel of touchscreens. For how advanced the cockpit appears, however, it's incredibly easy to navigate the systems.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6a4becb800190f6a54?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEverything the pilot could want to know about the aircraft could be found on the two screens from fuel burn to its checklists.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6f1041d50019f2dba6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOur flight plan for the day was a simple round-robin flight from White Plains, New York overflying the Long Island Sound, the Hamptons, and Montauk Point before heading back via the Connecticut coast.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd701041d50019f2dba8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt takes around 10 minutes for a pilot to get the plane completely set up for a flight. That's a key factor that allows VeriJet to sometimes launch flights within an hour of when they're booked.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd694becb800190f6a53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tKane quickly configured the aircraft and started the engine with the press of a button, not unlike the start/stop button on newer passenger vehicles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5d4becb800190f6a44?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe taxied out and in demonstration of the Vision Jet's safety features, Kane told the aircraft we were departing on a different runway than we actually were and \"forgot\" to turn on a certain setting, knowing the aircraft would catch both slip-ups. Both were perfectly safe to do.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6f4becb800190f6a58?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAs we lined up on Runway 32, a voice came on to tell us we were lined up on a different runway than planned. We, of course, were on the right runway and kept going but incorrect runway alignments have caused crashes in the past.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd684becb800190f6a51?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd once airborne, a message popped up reminding Kane that he hadn't set the pitot heat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd634becb800190f6a4d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThat was quickly corrected and we continued on our flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5f4becb800190f6a48?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe were flying at a low altitude so traffic avoidance was paramount. The area in which we were flying is prone to a large amount of leisure aircraft, as well as business jets.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6b1041d50019f2dba1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut the traffic collision avoidance system, also known as TCAS, pointed out exactly where other aircraft were so Kane didn't have to divert too much attention out of the window. It's just one of the systems onboard the Vision Jet that makes single-pilot operations easier, especially in complex airspace.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6083188f4becb800190f6e74?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1434\" width=\"1912\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnother vital system is the autothrottle. If Kane is given an airspeed to maintain by air traffic control, the autothrottle can be set and the aircraft will maintain the speed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6f1041d50019f2dba5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAn infrared sensor also lets Vision Jet pilots see through the clouds, ideal when landing in subpar conditions.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd641041d50019f2db99?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd weather radar helps avoid turbulence, rain, and thunderstorms.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd624becb800190f6a4a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tKane waited for the second-generation version of the Vision Jet to take advantage of these enhancements that aren’t found on the first-generation model.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6d1041d50019f2dba2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIf something happens to the pilot, passengers can press the big red button that activities Garmin's Safe Return, an autoland system that will guide the plane to the nearest usable airport.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5e4becb800190f6a47?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em><strong>Read More:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cirrus-vision-jet-autoland-safe-return-garmin-photos-2019-11\">The cheapest private jet in the world can now land itself with the push of a button. We tested the revolutionary new emergency system.</a></em></p>\n\tThe Vision Jet also comes with a parachute in case something is seriously wrong. But that's truly a last resort as it would completely total the aircraft.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd634becb800190f6a4c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOnce at cruise altitude, Kane flipped on the autopilot and let the aircraft do most of the work.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608329ac08610f0018b0f399?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"995\" width=\"1327\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe autopilot can handle speed, heading, and altitude, as well as following the assigned flight plan, just like on airliners.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5e4becb800190f6a46?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOnce the autopilot was set, it was time for the in-flight entertainment to begin. SiriusXM Satellite Radio is the primary form of entertainment, and Kane had all the channels available.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd621041d50019f2db96?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Vision Jet also has a massive screen that pops down from the ceiling and can be connected to via HDMI. There is low-speed WiFi on the plane but it isn't conducive to streaming Netflix, for example, but Kane said that board meetings have been held in the back of the plane using the screen.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd621041d50019f2db97?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPilots also don't have to worry about missing an important message from air traffic control when listening to the radio since the Vision Jet has an instant replay feature that rewinds a few seconds. It ensures pilots don't miss any pertinent information.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd604becb800190f6a49?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe arrived over the Hamptons in less than 20 minutes after takeoff. Driving from White Plains would have taken nearly three hours, or longer if during the summer weekend rush.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5a1041d50019f2db8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter overflying the famed Montauk Lighthouse and all the seals that visit Long Island this time of year, it was time to head back to White Plains.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd624becb800190f6a4b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe were flying over water at a low altitude and I was initially nervous that we were flying too low in case we lost our only engine. But Kane told me that the Vision Jet can glide at a 14.7:1 ratio, we'd be able to glide to shore and attempt to land or pull the parachute if conditions allowed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd611041d50019f2db94?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe aircraft can fly as far as 50 miles offshore due to its impressive gliding range.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5d1041d50019f2db90?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe were back over dry land soon enough and started preparing for the approach into White Plains.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6c4becb800190f6a57?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAll Kane had to do was tell the aircraft which runway to land on and which approach to fly.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd654becb800190f6a4f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe required frequencies and charts all auto-populated, reducing Kane's workload even more during the critical phase of flight so much so that he didn't have to touch any controls.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd671041d50019f2db9d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWestchester County Airport quickly came into view and the aircraft guided itself to land.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5d4becb800190f6a45?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWind was gusting across the approach path but the Vision Jet handled it well, controlling the aircraft's speed and pitch all the way down. This jet can fly approach speeds of around 90 knows, pretty much the same speed as piston aircraft.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5d1041d50019f2db8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tKane took over at the last few seconds to ensure the smoothest landing but said the jet was more than capable of performing the landing on its own.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd5c4becb800190f6a43?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn the last show of the Vision Jet's capabilities, air traffic control asked if we could make a 180-degree turn on the runway and the jet was able to do it seamlessly.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd594becb800190f6a3f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOverall, this jet is a great alternative to larger private jets when traveling short-haul, especially for the price.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dd6d1041d50019f2dba3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VeriJet Cirrus Vision Jet Demo Flight\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VeriJet&#39;s Cirrus Vision Jet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Pallini/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a efb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TaLGfIyGjHk:ex6mj4G57bg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn96@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-55-793_8f98c55a4232ccc4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/TaLGfIyGjHk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn40@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-59-719_feb18c1ed2fe14c5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596263},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"A QAnon believer, who smashed his way into the Capitol, believed he'd stormed the White House, FBI affidavit says","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-riot-qanon-believer-thought-hed-stormed-the-white-house-fbi-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60651c78daf0f10018f995fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Capitol Riot Trump Signs\" height=\"2660\" width=\"3547\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trump supporters clash with police and security forces as people try to storm the US Capitol on January 6\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brent Stirton/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A Florida man who stormed the Capitol confused the building for the White House, an affidavit says.</li>\n<li>Kenneth Kelly sent two text messages on January 6, referring to the Capitol as the &#34;White House.&#34;</li>\n<li>According to a relative, Kelly held extreme political views and was a QAnon believer.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A Florida man who <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/capitol-rioters-said-they-were-told-its-your-house-now-by-officer-2021-1\">stormed the Capitol on January 6</a> repeatedly referred to it as the &#34;White House&#34; in text messages to a relative, according to an <a href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-dc/case-multi-defendant/file/1389306/download\">affidavit </a>by an unnamed FBI special agent.</p><p>Kenneth Kelly, 58, of Ocala, Florida, was amid a group of people who <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-riot-suspect-bumble-user-tipped-off-fbi-2021-4\">broke the windows of the Capitol building</a> on January 6, the affidavit claims. </p><p>According to a relative identified in the affidavit only as &#34;W-1&#34;, Kelly sent them a text message on the day alongside an image that showed him standing inside what appears to be the Capitol.</p><p>&#34;Inside White house via breaking in windows,&#34; Kelly allegedly wrote in the text. &#34;Tree of liberty was watered today!&#34;</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/congress-capitol-hill-staff-burnout-remote-work-january-6-insurrection-2021-4\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">Congressional staffers are burned out and heading for the exits after a hellish year</a></em></p><p>The relative also claimed Kelly had driven to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-florida-mar-a-lago-bedminster-golf-2021-4\">Washington DC from his home in Florida</a>, &#34;knowing full well they were going to break in,&#34; according to the affidavit. </p><p>Kelly reportedly also sent another photo to a second witness, identified as &#34;W-2&#34;, which showed rioters scaling the side of the Capitol building, writing: &#34;Patriots stormed the White House, broke in while senate was in session...&#34;</p><p>&#34;Patriots took back our capital today,&#34; he added.</p><p>Screenshots of the text messages can be seen in the affidavit <a href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-dc/case-multi-defendant/file/1389306/download\">here</a>. </p><p>According to his relative, Kelly was a Trump supporter with &#34;extreme political views&#34; who had mentioned the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-filmmaker-may-have-uncovered-potential-identity-of-q-qanon-2021-4\">QAnon conspiracy theory</a> to them a few months before the riot. </p><p>Federal investigators said they were able to identify Kelly in a surveillance video from inside the Capitol building, wearing a dark blue beanie with &#34;TRUMP&#34; written across it.</p><p>The 58-year-old turned himself in on Friday and is facing charges of disorderly conduct in a restricted building, knowingly entering a restricted building, and violent entry and disorderly conduct on Capitol grounds, <a href=\"https://www.orlandosentinel.com/news/breaking-news/os-ne--20210424-7mmtlfn5rrcqjioccfrqyvbnra-story.html\">The Orlando Sentinel reported.</a></p><p>More than 430 people have so far been charged in connection to the riot, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/all-the-us-capitol-pro-trump-riot-arrests-charges-names-2021-1\">according to a tracker by Insider.</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-riot-qanon-believer-thought-hed-stormed-the-white-house-fbi-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/zAuCUzglhvQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 25 Apr 2021 14:41:42 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60651c78daf0f10018f995fb?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"eca7d640c13e84a293fc413ff430b19b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn7@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-36-732_c78f61533362a3bf.webp","destWidth":3547,"destHeight":2660,"sourceBytes":803798,"destBytes":803798,"author":"sankel@businessinsider.com (Sophia Ankel)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60651c78daf0f10018f995fb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn7@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-36-732_c78f61533362a3bf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn72@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-655_b04f51dc2b25b06b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn19@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-55-192_39d3483940cd932f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=zAuCUzglhvQ:IJGOVow63nE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn75@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-56-571_6cca665fc6ca0dd7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/zAuCUzglhvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn12@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-27-01-032_dc15b51daffa8549.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596208},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"This free, downloadable cookbook is aimed at helping COVID-19 long-haulers enjoy food again after losing their taste and smell","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-cookbook-help-covid-19-long-haulers-enjoy-food-again-2021-4","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60825e4b1041d50019f2dcd0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"noodles\" height=\"3001\" width=\"4002\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Sambal butter noodles from \"Taste &amp; Flavour.\" \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Craig Robertson via Life Kitchen</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>Some people who get COVID-19 develop lasting symptoms, like loss of taste or smell.</li> \n <li>A new cookbook was formulated specifically to help coronavirus long-haulers enjoy food again.</li> \n <li>The book, \"Taste &amp; Flavour,\" is available for free as a digital download.</li> \n <li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider's business page</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>For coronavirus long-haulers, loss of taste and smell is one of the persisting symptoms. Now, a new cookbook aims to help those people enjoy food again.</p>\n<p>The book, \"<a href=\"https://lifekitchen.co.uk/product/free-taste-flavour-book/\">Taste &amp; Flavour</a>,\" features 18 recipes with stunning food photography and is being offered for free as a digital download.</p>\n<p>UK Chefs Ryan Riley and Kimberley Duke spent months formulating the recipes, designed specifically for people experiencing an altered sense of taste and smell due to COVID-19.</p>\n<p>\"If you're living with taste loss no one talks about it,\" Riley told Insider. \"But six months of not being able to taste something and you form a mental barrier to food. It can become a mental health problem in itself.\"</p>\n<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60825fcd1041d50019f2dcd2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sweet vinegar aubs copy\" height=\"4999\" width=\"3999\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Sweet vinegar aubergines, or eggplant. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Craig Robertson via Life Kitchen</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>Researchers estimate <a href=\"https://health.ucdavis.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-information/covid-19-long-haulers.html\">about 10% of people</a> who become infected with COVID-19 become long-haulers, meaning they have symptoms that last for months and for some, indefinitely.</p>\n<p>A quarter of people who experience an altered sense of smell or taste improve within a couple of weeks, according to <a href=\"https://www.hopkinsmedicine.org/health/conditions-and-diseases/coronavirus/covid-long-haulers-long-term-effects-of-covid19\">John Hopkins Medicine</a>. But for most, the symptoms persist and some have gone more than a year without improvement.</p>\n<p>Riley and Duke, who run a <a href=\"https://lifekitchen.co.uk/\">cooking school for cancer patients</a> experiencing loss of taste, spent months working on the recipes. They consulted with <a href=\"https://london.ac.uk/news-and-opinion/prof-barry-smith-uk-lead-global-group-researching-loss-smell-a-covid-19-symptom#:~:text=The%20research%20will%20focus%20on,and%20its%20impact%20on%20taste.&amp;text=Professor%20Barry%20Smith%20says%2C%20%E2%80%9CThere,how%20much%20changes%20for%20them.hem.\">Barry Smith from the University of London's Centre for the study of the Senses</a>, a leading UK researcher for loss of smell as a COVID-19 symptom.</p>\n<p>Riley said about 80% of taste is actually smell, so the two senses are considerably intertwined. Some COVID-19 long-haulers experience anosmia, a loss of smell or taste, while others experience parosmia, a distorted sense of smell.</p>\n<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082607a4becb800190f6b84?format=jpeg\" alt=\"veggie tacos copy\" height=\"5388\" width=\"4006\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Veggie pineapple tacos. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Craig Robertson via Life Kitchen</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>Creating the recipes for the book involved heightening certain flavors while avoiding others. Coffee, for instance, can smell like sewage to some people with parosmia. Things like onion, garlic, eggs, roasted meat, and nuts can smell \"repulsive, almost like rotting flesh,\" Riley said.</p>\n<p>\"It's quite hard to write a recipe without garlic and onions,\" he said. \"They're the basis of flavor.\"</p>\n<p>Instead, the chefs focused on amplifying the savory flavors and \"adding texture and brightness to make up for the lack of depth.\"</p>\n<p>Riley and Duke tested nearly 300 recipes to narrow them down to the 18 that made it into the book. </p>\n<p>They relied on intense savory flavors like soy sauce, miso, parmesan, and mushrooms, and tried to touch on all five basic tastes - sweet, sour, salty, bitter, and umami - and stimulate all the senses. They also used ingredients that stimulate the trigeminal nerve, which is responsible for sensations in the face and sinuses and can be felt when eating foods like horseradish and wasabi.</p>\n<p>Riley called the miso butter potatoes with green herb vinegar the \"perfect\" recipe in that sense. The potatoes are umami-rich. The miso and soy sauce are umami and salty. The white pepper and fresh mint stimulate the trigeminal nerve. The green chile adds crunch for texture. The vinegar sets off the sour receptor.</p>\n<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60825f624becb800190f6b82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"miso butter copy\" height=\"5382\" width=\"3996\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   Miso butter potatoes with green herb vinegar. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Craig Robertson via Life Kitchen</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<p>Even though it seems like a simple recipe, Riley said, \"it's actually designed to stimulate all of the senses and a lot of the different taste buds, but also has to taste really nice.\"</p>\n<p>Riley said the reception to the book has been incredible, with people from around the world reaching out to thank them.</p>\n<p>\"Flavor is important. I think that's what we're desperately trying to make people understand,\" he said.</p>\n<p>Riley and Duke started <a href=\"https://lifekitchen.co.uk/\">Life Kitchen</a>, their free, nonprofit cooking school for cancer patients, after both had lost parents to cancer.</p>\n<p>\"I'd seen my mother go through all of the sadness and pain of not being able to eat,\" Riley, who lost his mother to cancer at age 20, said.</p>\n<p>In 2017, he first had the idea to do a one-off cooking class for cancer patients whose taste had been altered by the disease or the treatment. But after a tweet about the class went viral, they launched Life Kitchen as a full-time endeavor.</p>\n<p>\"It's depressing if you can't taste,\" he said. \"It's one of the biggest pleasures that we all take in this world. If you take that away, life really becomes a diminished experience.\"</p>\n<p><em>Have a news tip? Contact this reporter at </em><a href=\"mailto:kvlamis@insider.com?inline-read-more\"><em>kvlamis@insider.com</em></a><em>.</em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a Vlamis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60825e4b1041d50019f2dcd0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-36-797_9f6305d3d39c42f7.webp","https://i.insider.com/60825fcd1041d50019f2dcd2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn79@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-59-583_6b87fe4b575f9692.webp","https://i.insider.com/6082607a4becb800190f6b84?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn12@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-55-573_6bb10aeb317281c7.webp","https://i.insider.com/60825f624becb800190f6b82?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn1@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-03-745_1560763497d8f35a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=h_RnoIfFy_E:XCgzPC4iTIo:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn78@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-366_d59f6ea582aee149.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=h_RnoIfFy_E:XCgzPC4iTIo:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-55-455_78f8110a1c30a338.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=h_RnoIfFy_E:XCgzPC4iTIo:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-01-878_0845d81d9d6cf2ca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/h_RnoIfFy_E":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn29@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-01-182_01a080a86dc934cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596238},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"64% of Americans say they approve of the way Biden is responding to the pandemic, according to a new poll","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/64-of-americans-happy-with-bidens-pandemic-response-poll-says-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6085739e0da8f40018033533?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joe Biden\" height=\"2952\" width=\"5904\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden speaks at the White House.\n<p class=\"copyright\">MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>An ABC News/Washington Post poll found that 64% of people support Biden&#39;s pandemic response.</li>\n<li>In contrast, 59% of respondents in January said they disapproved of Trump&#39;s pandemic response.</li>\n<li>Biden&#39;s relief package is popular, and more than half of US adults are at least partially vaccinated.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The majority of Americans support President Joe Biden&#39;s response to the COVID-19 pandemic, according to an <a href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/bidens-100-days-low-end-approval-strong-marks/story?id=77218406&cid=social_twitter_abcnabcn\">ABC News/Washington Post poll</a> published Sunday.</p><p>According to the poll, 64% of people surveyed said they supported Biden&#39;s handling of the pandemic. In contrast, the majority of respondents - 59% - in a <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/context/jan-10-13-2021-washington-post-abc-news-poll/ab470cba-8e05-4692-af78-4949613740cc/\">January 2020 poll</a> said they disproved of then-President Donald Trump&#39;s response. At the time, 38% of Americans said they approved of Trump&#39;s pandemic response. </p><p>While Trump spent his last year in office downplaying the severity of the pandemic, Biden during his first 100 days has taken a more science-based approach and has more consistently <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-listened-anthony-fauci-but-didnt-do-what-he-said-2021-3\">relied on the advice of his advisers</a>.  </p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/doj-lawyer-women-soccer-equal-pay-case-biden-brian-netter-2021-4\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">Stephen Miller&#39;s new nemesis is a former lawyer for the US women&#39;s soccer team who&#39;ll now defend Biden&#39;s policies in court</a></em></p><p>In March, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stimulus-biden-signs-trillion-covid-relief-package-checks-direct-payments-2021-3\">Biden signed into law the $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan Act of 2021</a>, which among other measures, included $1,400 direct checks to most Americans. According to the poll published Sunday, 65% of Americans support the economic relief package.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/half-of-us-adults-had-one-dose-covid-19-vaccine-2021-4\">More than half of adults in the US have been at least partially vaccinated against the disease</a>. According to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Sunday, more than 226 million doses of the vaccine have been administered, putting Biden ahead of his goal of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-sets-goal-of-200-million-vaccines-in-first-100-days-by-april-30-2021-3\">200 million</a> jabs.</p><p>According to the poll, 52% of Americans approve of Biden&#39;s job in office so far, though his approval at the 100-day mark is lower than most of his modern-day predecessors, except for Trump, who had a 42% approval rating, and former President Gerald Ford, who had a 48% approval rating after spending his first 100 days in office.</p><p>Biden&#39;s lowest marks fall on his handling of immigration. Just 37% of Americans surveyed said they approved of Biden&#39;s response to immigration at the southern US border. Biden himself has called the situation along the border a &#34;crisis,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/19/politics/biden-border-crisis-unaccompanied-minors/index.html\">though the White House later backtracked those remarks.</a></p><p>On the economy, 52% of respondents said they approved of Biden&#39;s job, according to the poll, which surveyed 1,007 people from April 18 to 21.</p><p>A Harvard poll published Friday found that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-highest-favorability-rating-young-americans-harvard-poll-2021-4\">Biden had a record level of approval among young people</a>. According to the Institute of Politics at Harvard Kennedy School poll, 63% of young people approve of Biden&#39;s performance in office. Trump&#39;s approval among young people peaked at 33%, while former President Barack Obama peaked at 57%, the poll said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a pay","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-execs-leaving-droves-cloudkitchens-uber-capitol-hill-burnout-2021-4","description":"<p><em>Hello!</em></p><p><em>Welcome to this weekly roundup of stories from Insider&#39;s Business co-Editor in Chief Matt Turner. </em><a href=\"http://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-weekly\"><strong><em>Subscribe here to get this newsletter in your inbox every Sunday.</em></strong></a></p><p><em>What we&#39;re going over today:</em></p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\">Travis Kalanick&#39;s stealth $5 billion startup <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/travis-kalanicks-cloudkitchens-repeats-uber-playbook-loses-staff-2021-4\">CloudKitchens is Uber all over again</a>.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Amazon&#39;s most senior executives <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-executive-exodus-vps-other-senior-people-leaving-2021-4\">are leaving in droves.</a> </li><li aria-level=\"1\">A deep dive into the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-wall-street-quant-recruiting-2021-4\">secretive world of Wall Street quant recruiting.</a> </li><li aria-level=\"1\">Capitol Hill staffers are burned out, traumatized, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/congress-capitol-hill-staff-burnout-remote-work-january-6-insurrection-2021-4\">heading for the exits.</a> </li><li used to raise millions</a>.</li></ul><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/travis-kalanicks-cloudkitchens-repeats-uber-playbook-loses-staff-2021-4\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607728e342061500181757af?format=jpeg\" alt=\"travis kalanick cloudkitchen nightmare 4x3\" height=\"1876\" width=\"2501\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Justin Sullivan/Getty Images; Marianne Ayala/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p><em>What&#39;s trending this morning:</em></p><ul><li><strong>The US economy is barreling toward a boom: </strong>It&#39;s going to be <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-economy-barreling-toward-biggest-boom-since-1984-2021-4\">bigger, faster, and weirder than you expect</a>.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Jamie Dimon wants staff back in the office: </strong>The JPMorgan CEO expects the bank&#39;s employees <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jpmorgans-ceo-jamie-dimon-return-to-office-instagram-face-masks-2021-4\">back in the office &#34;within weeks&#34; and going maskless by October</a></li><li><strong><strong>The New York Times preps newsletter push: </strong></strong>Substack is trying to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-times-responds-to-the-substack-boom-2021-4\">poach its top writers with advances worth hundreds of thousands</a>.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong><strong>Walmart&#39;s healthcare leaders exit: </strong></strong>The retail giant is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/walmarts-health-clinics-are-stalling-as-leaders-depart-2021-4\">tapping the brakes on an ambitious clinic rollout</a>.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong><strong>New York&#39;s $7 billion cannabis industry: </strong></strong>It will be <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/list-top-cannabis-executive-advocates-regulators-new-york-2021-4\">shaped by these 27 power players</a>.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Want to buy a home right now?</strong> You might have to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/single-family-rental-investors-squeeze-regular-homebuyers-cerberus-invitation-homes-2021-4\">outbid a $50 billion private equity firm first</a>.</li></ul><hr><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/travis-kalanicks-cloudkitchens-repeats-uber-playbook-loses-staff-2021-4\"><strong>CloudKitchens is Uber&#39;s carbon copy</strong></a></h3><p>Hundreds of employees left Travis Kalanick&#39;s ghost-kitchen startup this year - in an exodus that reflects long-simmering tensions about leadership, secrecy, and pay. Inside the organization, people <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/travis-kalanicks-cloudkitchens-repeats-uber-playbook-loses-staff-2021-4\">described an alpha-male society</a> reflective of Kalanick&#39;s first startup:</p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>The Kalanick leading CloudKitchens was not changed, humbled, or reformed. He was the same Kalanick who in just a few roller-coaster years had turned Uber into a global juggernaut - at one point the world&#39;s most valuable tech startup - by barreling full speed ahead and ultimately crashing out.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>In one important way, though, Kalanick has changed. The man leading CloudKitchens is incredibly concerned with secrecy and preventing any challenges to his control, and he has designed the company with that in mind.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>The result is a business that looks like the old Uber - but without the guardrails. Without a VC-filled board, Kalanick, who reportedly owns about half the company, enjoys free rein to pursue his vision of reinventing the restaurant business.</em></p><p>Read up on Kalanick&#39;s new startup:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/travis-kalanicks-cloudkitchens-repeats-uber-playbook-loses-staff-2021-4\"><strong>Travis Kalanick&#39;s stealth $5 billion startup, CloudKitchens, is Uber all over again, ruled by a &#39;temple of bros,&#39; insiders say</strong></a></li></ul><p>Also read:</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/uber-ceo-dara-khosrowshahi-cleaned-uber-toxic-culture-travis-kalanick-2021-4\">Inside Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi&#39;s 4-year quest to root out the toxic culture that nearly sank the world&#39;s most valuable startup</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-first-time-founders-got-screwed-by-dirty-term-sheets-2021-4\">Startup founders, VCs, and lawyers open up about the dark world of dirty term sheets, where shrewd investors screw them over</a><br><section></section></li></ul><section></section><hr><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-executive-exodus-vps-other-senior-people-leaving-2021-4\"><strong>Amazon&#39;s executive exodus</strong></a></h3><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-executive-exodus-vps-other-senior-people-leaving-2021-4\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60248d8867d1e300113c5711?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon Jeff Bezos\" height=\"2250\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jason Redmond/Redmond</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>The company is going through the largest leadership shakeup in its history, with VPs citing better pay, bigger roles, and Amazon&#39;s slowing culture as their reasons for leaving. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-executive-exodus-vps-other-senior-people-leaving-2021-4\">More than 45 top executives have left</a> since the start of 2020:</p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Given that Amazon has about 350 vice presidents, that&#39;s a turnover rate of more than 10% in the vice-presidential level and above - rare for a company that once prided itself on the loyalty and long employment history of its most valued senior leaders. </em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>It&#39;s one of the most dramatic management upheavals in company history. As Amazon looks to a post-Bezos era, the departures present incoming CEO Andy Jassy with the dual challenge of having to work with less familiar faces while maintaining the company&#39;s unique culture.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>&#34;The risk-reward isn&#39;t there for big leaders to stay at Amazon right now,&#34; one former Amazon executive who left in the past year told Insider. &#34;It would not surprise me if 2021 has more VP attrition than 2020.&#34;</em></p><p>See what former employees said about the Amazon exodus:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-executive-exodus-vps-other-senior-people-leaving-2021-4\"><strong>Amazon&#39;s most senior execs are leaving in droves, citing stalling growth, higher pay elsewhere, and a tough culture - setting the stage for Andy Jassy&#39;s first major challenge as CEO</strong></a></li></ul><p>Also read:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-leaked-memo-focus-performance-review-unregretted-attrition-2021-4\">Internal memo shows one tactic Amazon uses to force a set number of employees out every year</a></li><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/microsoft-companies-could-buy-acquisitions-nuance-startups-2021-4\">22 companies Microsoft is most likely to acquire next</a><br><section></section></li></ul><hr><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-wall-street-quant-recruiting-2021-4\"><strong>Wall Street&#39;s secretive world of quant recruiting</strong></a></h3><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-wall-street-quant-recruiting-2021-4\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6075a0f33e3fe7001882a4e3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wall street quant hedge fund recruiting 4x3\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AQR; DE Shaw &#38; Co; Citadel; Two Sigma; DRW; Point 72; Samantha Lee/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>The market for quant and data-science specialists on Wall Street has never been hotter, but <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-wall-street-quant-recruiting-2021-4\">the trading firms that employ them are highly secretive</a> - as are the recruiters they work with:</p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>&#34;You&#39;re OK that I&#39;ve recorded this call, right?&#34; </em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>So said one veteran recruiter who works with proprietary-trading firms before apologizing for his paranoia at the end of a 30-minute conversation. Other headhunters wanted to ensure up front that Insider wasn&#39;t secretly recording them (we weren&#39;t), and agreed to speak only on the condition of anonymity - that what they said wouldn&#39;t be attributed to them or their company. Some would dish about the industry or their competitors, but discussing clients was verboten.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Welcome to the secretive world of Wall Street quant recruiting. </em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>While secrecy abounds across finance, it&#39;s especially prevalent in the world of quantitative trading, where noncompetes in excess of a year, nondisclosure agreements, and lawsuits over defectors are common. </em></p><p>Here&#39;s what more than two dozen quant recruiters about their competitive, stealthy field:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-wall-street-quant-recruiting-2021-4\"><strong>Inside the secretive world of Wall Street quant recruiting</strong></a></li></ul><p>Also read:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-headhunters-that-specialize-in-wall-street-quant-recruiting-2021-4\">The talent brokers of quant trading: The headhunters at the forefront of Wall Street&#39;s systematic-trading and data-science hiring frenzy</a></li><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wall-street-responds-with-cash-bonuses-as-banker-burnout-mounts-2021-3\">Wall Street is bumping junior pay and going on a hiring spree. Here&#39;s a rundown of all the special bonuses and raises announced in recent weeks.</a></li></ul><hr><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/congress-capitol-hill-staff-burnout-remote-work-january-6-insurrection-2021-4\"><strong>Workers on Capitol Hill have hit a wall</strong></a></h3><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/congress-capitol-hill-staff-burnout-remote-work-january-6-insurrection-2021-4\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082ea254becb800190f6d61?format=jpeg\" alt=\"commitee staffer senate staff\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/committee-staffer-prepares-the-video-streaming-for-senators-news-photo/1227718830\" target=\"_blank\">Samuel Corum/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>Congressional staffers at all levels - from fellows to chiefs of staff - <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/congress-capitol-hill-staff-burnout-remote-work-january-6-insurrection-2021-4\">have struggled with burnout,</a> several current and former employees told Insider. They described how remote work obliterated the line between their work and personal lives:</p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>&#34;It was the working from home, it was the level of intensity of being a chief of staff, the recent passing of my mother,&#34; that led Jose Borjon to look for a job outside the public sector.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Even in normal times, working on Capitol Hill is no walk in the park. But after a pandemic, a year of remote work, feverish partisan rancor surrounding the 2020 presidential election, and an unprecedented terrorist attack inside their place of employment, the thousands of congressional staffers who make Congress run are burning out. Badly.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Current staff and experts fear the exhaustion and trauma are pushing qualified people out the door, exacerbating the long-running problem of brain drain on Capitol Hill while denying lawmakers talented staff members as they try to tackle some of the most pressing issues to face the country in generations.</em></p><p>Get the full scoop:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/congress-capitol-hill-staff-burnout-remote-work-january-6-insurrection-2021-4\"><strong>Congressional staffers are burned out and heading for the exits after a hellish year</strong></a></li></ul><p>Also read:</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-trump-justice-department-criminal-investigation-new-york-georgia-2021-4\">Prosecuting Trump does not look like a DOJ priority under Biden&#39;s attorney general. But watch Georgia and New York.</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-florida-mar-a-lago-bedminster-golf-2021-4\">Trump plots temporary move from Mar-a-Lago north to New Jersey</a><br><section></section></li></ul><section></section><hr><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/searchable-database-of-business-insider-pitch-decks-2020-7\">Pitch deck library</a></h2><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/searchable-database-of-business-insider-pitch-decks-2020-7\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1b36364dca68235b2f467f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pitchdeck database 2x1\" height=\"834\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shayanne Gal/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>Billions of dollars in venture capital flow every year to startups that can articulate their visions in a way that makes investors see dollar signs.</p><p>Startups do this by creating pitch decks, or slideshows that meld imagery, hard data, and storytelling to help investors see their potential.</p><p>For years, Insider has been publishing individual pitch decks to give readers an inside look at startups&#39; business strategies and how they wooed investors to back them.</p><p>We have now been combined them into a searchable database. Check it out here:</p><section><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/searchable-database-of-business-insider-pitch-decks-2020-7\">PITCH-DECK LIBRARY: Search over 350 pitch decks that startups including Uber, Postmates, and Airbnb used to raise millions</a></strong></p><hr></section><p>Lastly, don&#39;t forget to <a href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/?utm_source=insider&utm_medium=partnership&utm_campaign=insiderweekly_h12021&irclickid=Q303QBR7zxyLTbn0MdV3iVCmUkES-e1ho2DpzQ0&utm_source=impact&utm_medium=affiliate&utm_campaign=10078&irgwc=1&irclickid=Q303QBR7zxyLTbn0MdV3iVCmUkB0rmT1o2DpzQ0&utm_source=impact&utm_medium=affiliate&utm_campaign=10078&irgwc=1ium=affiliate&#38;utm_campaign=10078&#38;irgwc=1\">check out Morning Brew</a> - Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, during a White House press briefing on January 21, 2021 in Washington.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul regulators added a warning label about the small risk of blood clots for women under 50.</li>\n<li>Fauci said the pause should show Americans that the US takes &#34;safety very seriously.&#34;</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Dr. Anthony Fauci on Sunday said he didn&#39;t believe that the pause of the Johson &#38; Johnson COVID-19 vaccine, which lasted for about a week, would lead to further vaccine hesitancy among Americans because it showed the US&#39; commitment to safety. </p><p>The US last week <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/johnson-and-johnson-coronavirus-vaccine-rollout-resumes-2021-4\">resumed the use of the J&#38;J vaccine</a> following a pause to allow regulators to examine the rare risk of blood clots associated with the shot. In resuming the rollout Friday, the FDA added a warning about the rare risk of clots in women under the age of 50.</p><p>Janet Woodcock, the acting administrator of the Food and Drug Administration, said Friday that regulators had &#34;full confidence that this vaccine&#39;s known and potential benefits outweigh its known and potential risks.&#34; The CDC said states could begin using the vaccine immediately.</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/optumhealth-ceo-plans-to-make-clinics-a-100-billion-business-2021-4\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">The CEO of UnitedHealth&#39;s sprawling health-clinic business shared how transforming the way doctors get paid will help it notch $100 billion in revenue</a></em></p><p>Fauci on Sunday said that the pause should bolster Americans&#39; confidence that all of the vaccines are safe.</p><p>&#34;I think, in the long run, what we&#39;re going to see, and we&#39;ll probably see it soon, is that people will realize that we take safety very seriously,&#34; Fauci <a href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/week-transcript-25-21-rep-karen-bass-sen/story?id=77289809\">said during an appearance on ABC News&#39; &#34;This Week.&#34;</a> &#34;We&#39;re out there trying to combat the degree of vaccine hesitancy that still is out there. And one of the real reasons why people have hesitancy is concern about the safety of the vaccine.&#34;</p><p>Some people in the US, particularly Republicans, have expressed hesitancy about the COVID-19 vaccines, their effectiveness, and their safety, despite public health officials&#39; repeated assurances they&#39;re safe and necessary to bring the coronavirus pandemic to an end. </p><p>A <a href=\"https://www.monmouth.edu/polling-institute/documents/monmouthpoll_us_041421.pdf/\">Monmouth poll conducted in April</a> found that 43% of Republicans said they were not likely ever get one of the vaccines. In total, about 1 in 5 American adults said they were unwilling to get one of the shots, according to the poll.</p><p>Fauci noted that out of the more than 140 million people who have received at least one vaccine dose, 8 million people have received the J&#38;J jab. According to the CDC, among those 8 million vaccinations, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-johnson-johnson-blood-clot-case-count-rises-to-15-2021-4\">there are 15 known cases of  clots</a> - all in women under the age of 60. Three of the cases were fatal, the CDC last week said.</p><p>&#34;So if anybody has any doubts about the safety of those other vaccines, and including J&#38;J, we can now say, you know, we take this very seriously; we&#39;ve looked at it; now let&#39;s get back and get people vaccinated,&#34; said Fauci, the chief medical adviser to President Joe Biden.</p><p>&#34;And that&#39;s what we&#39;re going to be doing, get as many people vaccinated as we possibly can, as quickly as we can, because we have a very, very effective vaccine for the people here and throughout the world,&#34; he added.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/fauci-johnson-johnson-vaccine-pause-shows-safety-seriously-2021-4'>Business
