+0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608599683f0560001881be9b?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e406acef183e495327c5517638534a11","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn19@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-54-553_b4e63ec9ec0b9ea5.webp","destWidth":1955,"destHeight":1466,"sourceBytes":89342,"destBytes":89342,"author":"insider@insider.com (Connor Perrett)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6085996a0da8f40018033550?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn80@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-56-561_7e693ad0fefa07de.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1bPN3YiYBpA:4NRK1t_Al0U:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn27@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-02-990_13ecf3da381b89e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1bPN3YiYBpA:4NRK1t_Al0U:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn55@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-58-239_459e69152f90e606.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1bPN3YiYBpA:4NRK1t_Al0U:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn5@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-02-815_c6a030796d46e1c7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/1bPN3YiYBpA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn18@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-534_c323abb974e3ba08.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596257},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"The US will help India produce more coronavirus vaccines, releasing raw materials and expanding factories in broad push to blunt its COVID-19 crisis","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-to-help-india-with-covid-19-crisis-through-vaccine-production-supplies-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60859e220da8f40018033555?format=jpeg\" alt=\"India\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People are administered COVID-19 vaccine in Mumbai, India, Tuesday, April 13, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Rajanish Kakade</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The US will provide supplies for testing, drugs, and vaccines to fight India&#39;s COVID-19 crisis.</li>\n<li> A National Security Council spokesperson said the US is &#34;working around the clock&#34; to help India.</li>\n<li>Resources include raw materials and funding needed needed to ramp up vaccine manufacturing.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The US is providing a broad package of relief to India, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JakeSullivan46/status/1386359529865162752\">government leaders said Sunday</a>, as the world&#39;s second-most populous country fights a historic wave of COVID-19. </p><p>The US will immediately make available raw materials needed to produce Covishield, the Indian brandname for the AstraZeneca-University of Oxford vaccine, as well as personal protective equipment, testing kits, drugs, and ventilators, Emily Horne, a spokesperson for the US National Security Council, said in a statement Sunday. </p><p>The US will also fund an expansion of one of India&#39;s leading vaccine manufacturers, BioE. Money from the US Development Finance Corporation will allow BioE to produce 1 billion doses of coronavirus vaccine by the end of 2022, Horne said. </p><p>Horne&#39;s statement followed a Sunday call between US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan and Ajit Doval, the top national security advisors for India. The readout did not specify how much raw materials, diagnostics, therapeutics, and other medical equipment will be provided by the US&#39; action.</p><p>India recorded 349,691 new cases on Sunday, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/india-coronavirus-cases-set-new-global-record-us-readies-help-2021-04-25/\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"1febcd4013707d28165b331d254b1c31\">smashing a global record for a fourth consecutive day</a>. Hospitals are being overrun and medical supplies are in short supply. Vaccinations have also been few and far between, with <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=Hhue1scO\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"6b87fb1dc299eef8949e2a3e6c61f1da\">less than 2% of the population fully immunized</a>.</p><p>Hospitals are <a href=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.businessinsider.com/india-hospitals-report-dire-oxygen-shortages-coronavirus-battle-2021-4&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1619092975752000&usg=AFQjCNHNSZdtzY6MKao1-nEQgCY2CSnsKAo1-nEQgCY2CSnsKA\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"a70472e4aa6e9cde0574399d612966fe\">struggling among shortages of beds and oxygens</a>, some saying they only have a few hours&#39; of oxygen supply left. </p><p>Over the last few days, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-pressured-to-donate-covid-19-vaccine-to-india-2021-4\">a growing chorus of doctors and public-health experts have urged the US government to do more</a>, including donating vaccine doses and providing raw materials.</p><p>Horne&#39;s statement did not reference a donation of any existing vaccine doses that the US has. Some experts have called for the US to donate its supply of AstraZeneca&#39;s shot, which has not won authorization in the US. </p><p>The US government signed a deal with AstraZeneca last summer to eventually deliver 300 million doses of the shot. The US already has <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/11/us/politics/coronavirus-astrazeneca-united-states.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/11/us/politics/coronavirus-astrazeneca-united-states.html\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"a8aca57bccdd23f5da071c86a1a40463\">at least 30 million of those doses on hand</a>, a supply which experts say would be best used by donating to other nations that need it.</p><p>Dr. Ashish Jha, dean of Brown University School of Public Health, called the US&#39; assistance <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ashishkjha/status/1386366328924221441\">&#34;excellent steps,&#34;</a> while noting it does not mention using the American supply of AstraZeneca&#39;s shot.</p><p>The US and India will &#34;stay in close touch in coming days,&#34; Horne said, with the US &#34;working around the clock to deploy available resources and supplies.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Cisco's CEO says he expects computer chip shortages to last for another six months","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cisco-ceo-chuck-robbins-chip-shortages-last-six-months-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ff88f9bd184b30018aadc82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Semiconductor manufacturing.\" height=\"2649\" width=\"3532\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nvidia semiconductor manufacturing.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/photo/technician-holding-chip-over-defocused-circuit-royalty-free-image/168649619?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Krystian Nawrocki/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Cisco&#39;s CEO has said the global computer chip crunch is set to last for six months. </li>\n<li>About 85% of internet traffic uses Cisco&#39;s systems, <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-56847518\">according to the BBC</a>. </li>\n<li>The disruptions are also spreading to affect the production of domestic appliances like toasters. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Cisco&#39;s chief executive Chuck Robbins said the global shortage of computer chips is expected to last for most of this year.</p><p>&#34;We think we&#39;ve got another six months to get through the short term,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-56847518\">he told the BBC.</a></p><p>Supply-chain disruptions in semiconductors have impacted many tech firms, caused by a surge in demand for electronics prompted by the COVID-19 pandemic and chip shortages at large production facilities,<a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/9a497f21-e3e4-4c74-8737-07cd13209475\"> The Financial Times reported.</a></p><p>This has prompted providers to build out more capacity, Robbins <a href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-56847518\">told the BBC</a>. And &#34;that&#39;ll get better and better over the next 12 to 18 months,&#34; he said.</p><p>Expansion of capacity will be vital as demand soars. The shortage is a big problem, Robbins said, &#34;because semiconductors go in virtually everything.&#34;</p><p>As a result of the dwindling supply, makers of smartphones, televisions, and home appliances have seen <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/global-chip-shortage-4-experts-predict-how-long-affect-markets-2021-4-1030295270\">delays in production</a>, The disruptions are also affecting the production of other domestic appliances such as toasters and washing machines. </p><p>The COVID-19 pandemic is not the only possible factor in computer chip supply shortages. At the start of this month, the US added Chinese supercomputing companies to its export blacklist for assisting the Chinese military, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/us-adds-chinese-supercomputing-entities-economic-blacklist-2021-04-08/\">Reuters reported</a>. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on alt=\"Costco food court counter\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Irene Jiang / Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>I visited Costco&#39;s famous food court during the pandemic.</li>\n<li>The chain is known for it&#39;s $1.50 soda and hot dog deal.</li>\n<li>Dining areas were closed because of COVID, but Costco is planning to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/costco-reopening-food-courts-adding-back-menu-items-2021-4\">reopen</a> them soon.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tCostco's food court is one of the major draws for members of the big box store.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e37ccad5bc79c1cbf113f33?format=jpeg\" alt=\"costco food court\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kate Taylor/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn March of 2020, Costco closed down seating areas at food courts and cut back menus. Now, the company has plans to reopen them and bring back beloved menu items.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dcfb644f454001920788e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEarly on in the pandemic, customers could only buy pizza and hot dogs to-go.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dcfe944f4540019207892?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tNow, my local Costco location in Rochester, NY is selling hot dogs, pizzas, chicken bakes, and fountain drinks.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dcfa044f454001920788d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tCOVID safety measures are still in place, though.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tCostco is encouraging customers to order through kiosks and reduce interaction with workers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dd06874da0300181e28cb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe little kiosks are separated by plexiglass dividers, though no one else was ordering when I used one.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter ordering, you get a receipt with your order number, and you can wait near the pickup window.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dd09f74da0300181e28d1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThat's also where you get cups for the fountain machine.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dd0d244f454001920789e?format=jpeg\" Costco requires a new cup each time to cut down on potential contamination.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dd0ee74da0300181e28d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" hand sanitizer stations and napkins.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dca7e44f4540019207861?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" add back seating in some areas as COVID rates go down.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dd19744f45400192078a5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"3024\" feet away from workers and other customers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607dd20344f45400192078ab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court Covid\" height=\"1360\" width=\"1814\" class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tEven with a limited menu, Costco's food court is a good deal. We got a slice of pizza, a hot dog, chicken bake, and two drinks for under $8.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607de31874da0300181e293d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"costcoReceipt\" and the price hasn't changed since the deal launched in 1985.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607de1f744f454001920790d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Costco food court hot dog\" height=\"1666\" //feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/cVmsIDVKOsM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn31@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-57-085_81f6eccef41143cf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596240},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"How to delete your TikTok account permanently","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-delete-tiktok-account","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6085934a3f0560001881be9a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tiktok app\" height=\"806\" width=\"1613\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to delete your TikTok account through the app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>To delete TikTok, tap the three-dot menu in your profile tab, then tap &#34;Manage my account&#34; and &#34;Delete account.&#34;</li>\n<li>Once you confirm your decision, your account will be &#34;deactivated&#34; for 30 days. After 30 days, your account will be permanently deleted.</li>\n<li>If you never signed up for a TikTok account, you can just uninstall the app. </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\"><strong>Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Whether you have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-tiktok-safe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">privacy concerns</a> or you&#39;re troubled by what <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/how-does-social-media-affect-teenagers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">short-form videos might be doing to your attention span</a>, there are valid reasons why it may be time to delete your TikTok account. </p><p>If you do choose to delete your TikTok, keep in mind that all of your videos will be deleted unless it was saved or downloaded by another user. So before you do the deed, make sure to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-delete-a-tiktok\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">save any favorite videos on your phone</a>. </p><p>Once you back up the videos you&#39;d like to keep, here&#39;s how to say goodbye to TikTok for good.</p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2><strong>How to delete TikTok account</strong></h2><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/lWmbTR-zjzo\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe><p><br>If you downloaded the app just to watch videos and never signed up for an account, you can just delete the app from your phone. If you do have an account, follow the steps below to actually delete your account. <br><br></p><ol><li>Open the TikTok app, and tap the &#34;Me&#34; profile button in the bottom right-hand corner of the app.  </li><li>Tap the three-dot menu in the top-right corner of the screen.</li><li>Select &#34;Manage my account&#34; and then tap &#34;Delete account&#34; at the bottom of the screen.</li><li>Follow the on-screen prompts and tap &#34;Delete account&#34; again to confirm your decision.</li></ol></aside><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Important: </strong>After this process, your account will only be &#34;deactivated&#34;. In case you change your mind, simply <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-recover-tiktok-account\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">log back in to reactivate your account</a>. After 30 days, deleted TikTok accounts are permanently closed and cannot be recovered. </p></aside><p>After you delete your account, the last and final step to permanently deleting TikTok is to uninstall the app from your phone.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"605cc8de10707e2e5065288b\" data-title=\"Is TikTok safe? Levay</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Event Horizon Telescope revealed the first image of a massive black hole, outlined by rings of light showing the intense gravitational field.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6085773d0da8f40018033539?format=jpeg\" alt=\"eso2105a\" height=\"960\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A view of the M87 supermassive black hole in polarised light.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.eso.org/public/images/eso2105a/\" target=\"_blank\">European Southern Observatory</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Hubble Telescope took a portrait of the \"Lost Galaxy,\" located around 50 million light-years from Earth.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608580030da8f40018033540?format=jpeg\" alt=\"potw2103a\" height=\"780\" width=\"1041\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The &#34;Lost Galaxy.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">ESA/Hubble &#38; NASA, J. 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"I compared Taco Bell's new meatless taco with the chain's classic vegan favorite and found the original is still the best","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/review-taco-bell-new-vegan-meat-cravetarian-bean-taco-favorite-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60823c174becb800190f6b22?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0730\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>On April 21, Taco Bell expanded its veggie-friendly menu with a new plant-based protein: the Cravetarian.</li>\n<li>I tried the Cravetarian and Taco Bell&#39;s popular vegetarian protein, black beans, in two Crunchy Taco Supremes.</li>\n<li>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme was far better than the Cravetarian taco.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tTaco Bell has long been popular with vegetarians and vegans.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6065f72352f11d00194319bb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Go Mobile\" height=\"667\" width=\"889\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Taco Bell in Oklahoma has been converted into a Go Mobile format.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taco Bell</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt even offers a \"Veggie Mode\" menu full of meat-free options ...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e6e54becb800190f6d34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Taco Bell Veggie Items 2\" height=\"1517\" width=\"2023\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taco Bell</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... all made with American Vegetarian Association certified ingredients.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e75c1041d50019f2dea6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Taco Bell&#39;s new Vegetarian Menu Board\" height=\"1042\" width=\"1390\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Taco Bell&#39;s menu now includes a &#34;vegetarian favorites&#34; section.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taco Bell</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.tacobell.com/blog/how-to-eat-veggie\">Taco Bell</a></em></p>\n\t\"People who have been flexitarian or vegetarian have known that we've been the go-to place where you can actually get a healthy, plant-based protein that you can sub into your food,\" Julie Felss Masino, now-president of Taco Bell International, told Insider in 2019.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608231a01041d50019f2dc5a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Taco Bell vegetarian menu\" height=\"3746\" width=\"7493\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The four dishes on Taco Bell&#39;s new all-vegetarian menu.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taco Bell</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd on April 21, Taco Bell continued this veggie-friendly reputation by introducing a new plant-based meat: the Cravetarian.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60802b0f74da0300181e2e8e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Taco bell cravetarian protein\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Taco Bell</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/taco-bell-vegan-plant-based-protein-chickpeas-beyond-meat-cravetarian-2021-4\">Insider</a></em></p>\n\tFast-food chains like McDonald's or Burger King have used companies like Impossible Foods or Beyond Meat for a veggie-friendly solution. But Taco Bell took a different approach by creating its own vegan protein.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e7eb1041d50019f2deb5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"impossible burger\" height=\"1498\" width=\"1997\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Raoux/AP Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe new proprietary vegan option is made of a spiced mixture of peas and chickpeas, the later a classic protein option for vegans.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608237d34becb800190f6b15?format=jpeg\" alt=\"taco bell\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Crunchy Taco Supreme with the Cravetarian.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSeveral of Taco Bell’s meat-based menu items can be substituted with this new vegan protein …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608237e34becb800190f6b17?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0424\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Taco Bell&#39;s ground beef, left, and the Cravetarian, right.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t… which means you can have a chalupa, burrito, or Crunchwrap Supreme with the new fake meat.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608230f41041d50019f2dc53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0387\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Crunchwrap Supreme with the Cravetarian.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAt the moment, the Cravetarian is only available at one location: 14042 Red Hill Ave. in Tustin, California. I happen to be temporarily located just a short drive away from this location and decided to check out the new product for myself.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608238211041d50019f2dc76?format=jpeg\" alt=\"taco bell\" height=\"797\" width=\"1595\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Taco Bell.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tDisclaimer, I'm not a vegetarian, but I do prefer vegetables over meat, and often opt for meat-free meals. Most of my meals are currently plant-based.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608238301041d50019f2dc77?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0423\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Crunchwrap Supreme with the Cravetarian.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter a short drive over the freeway, I arrived at the coveted Tustin location. I was too lazy to leave the comforts of my car, so I opted for the drive-thru.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082386e4becb800190f6b19?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0574\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The drive-thru.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI decided to order two Crunchy Taco Supremes with no cheese or sour cream in order to vegan-ify my order. I ordered one with the Cravetarian protein, and the other with black beans. Both rung in at $2.19.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082412a1041d50019f2dca9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0120\" height=\"1879\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My drive-thru order.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe vegan iteration of the Crunchy Taco Supreme comes with lettuce, tomato, and a protein of your choice.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608236b81041d50019f2dc6a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0655\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUnfortunately, the chopped tomatoes were left out of my Cravetarian taco, so I took some from the black bean taco for flavor and aesthetic consistency.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241224becb800190f6b4f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0720\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Cravetarian taco looked gloriously identical to Taco Bell's ground beef offerings, down to the color and small clumps.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608238cc1041d50019f2dc7a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0651\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tMeanwhile, the black bean taco looked, well, like it had black beans. Nothing new or special.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241374becb800190f6b50?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0658\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut I always root for the underdog, so I decided to try the black bean taco first.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082413f4becb800190f6b51?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0682\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTaco Bell's bean offerings, whether refried or black, are a well-known favorite among the plant-based community, and notably certified vegan.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082392b1041d50019f2dc7b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0626\" height=\"1267\" width=\"1690\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The refried bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd after having my first bite of the Crunchy Taco Supreme with black beans, I totally understand why.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241481041d50019f2dcaa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0662\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe beans were salty, flavorful, well seasoned, and not too mushy.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241504becb800190f6b52?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0690\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt was delicious!\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241554becb800190f6b53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0704\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI thoroughly enjoyed my first few bites and quickly wolfed down the rest of the taco before I even had time to consider whether I needed more pictures of it.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082415c1041d50019f2dcab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0681\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme might be the best vegan fast food item I've ever tried.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241634becb800190f6b54?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0691\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI was initially worried about the lack of sour cream and cheese (I could eat bowls of both with a spoon) but didn't miss either dairy product while munching on my little taco.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241691041d50019f2dcac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0670\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe well-balanced black beans brought enough of a flavor punch on their own.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082416f4becb800190f6b55?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0700\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI was surprised by how much I enjoyed the taco. I enjoy eating beans, but I initially did not have high expectations for Taco Bell's take on the classic black beans.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608237111041d50019f2dc72?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0707\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWith my bar set extremely high and my stomach almost full, I decided it was time to try the Cravetarian taco.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608239b44becb800190f6b1d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"taco bell\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Crunchy Taco Supreme with the Cravetarian, sour cream, and cheese.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut to my dismay, the Cravetarian filling paled in comparison to the black beans.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082372e4becb800190f6b12?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0716\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Cravetarian tastes similar to other meat substitutes I've tried before.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241854becb800190f6b56?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0741\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's salty (maybe a bit too salty), spongy, well seasoned, and has notes of hummus.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60823b514becb800190f6b20?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0454\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Taco Bell&#39;s ground beef, left, and the Cravetarian, right.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut the longer the Cravetarian sat and the colder it got, the spongier the filling felt.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241964becb800190f6b57?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0736\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIf you're looking for a substitute that tastes identical to meat, be prepared to be disappointed by the Cravetarian.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60823b8d4becb800190f6b21?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0719\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut if you like the taste of meat substitutes, you're in luck.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60823b351041d50019f2dc7e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0723\" height=\"1142\" width=\"1523\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhile I enjoy the \"vegan meat\" flavor, Taco Bell's Cravetarian was nothing new.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241a34becb800190f6b58?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0724\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI had hoped for some Taco Bell pizzazz but was left disappointed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241aa4becb800190f6b59?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0732\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean and Cravetarian Crunchy Taco Supremes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn the end, I wish I had purchased two black bean tacos instead of a Cravetarian. In this case, I'll stick with the classics.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608241b21041d50019f2dcad?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0759\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The black bean Crunchy Taco Supreme.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original .net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn99@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-56-201_8636370fc9018265.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=L0pjGPLWgvY:ekDcExCbFkY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn72@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-55-316_e482e5212795aca2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=L0pjGPLWgvY:ekDcExCbFkY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn69@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-767_ec87d26190628118.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=L0pjGPLWgvY:ekDcExCbFkY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn75@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-55-671_9d5961157b9f69ce.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/L0pjGPLWgvY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn35@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-58-969_52ba8bf9aa675910.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596227},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"A third-party seller whose baby-care business raked in $20 million in sales last year reveals his secret to selling on Amazon, Walmart, and Target","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/keababies-founder-shares-tips-for-selling-on-amazon-walmart-target-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e3fc1041d50019f2de80?format=jpeg\" alt=\"keababies\" height=\"1500\" width=\"1999\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>KeaBabies founders Ivan Ong and Jane Neo pose with their two sons.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Keababies</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Third-party sales are becoming an increasingly important facet of the e-commerce business.</li>\n<li>Ivan Ong, owner of KeaBabies, earned $20 million in sales in 2020.</li>\n<li>He shared his experiences selling on platforms, including Amazon, Walmart, Target, and Kroger.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>There&#39;s millions of dollars to be made as a third-party seller on online marketplaces run by Amazon, Walmart, and Target.</p><p>Just ask Ivan Ong, whose international KeaBabies business offers maternity and baby-care products and generated around $20 million in sales last year. KeaBabies&#39; products are also featured on third-party marketplaces like Kroger and Macy&#39;s.</p><p>The brand, founded by Ong and his wife Jane Neo in Singapore in 2016, additionally utilizes Shopify, wholesaling website Faire, along with plenty of advertisements on Google, Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, to drive sales from its own website. Ong credited the company&#39;s multi-pronged customer acquisition strategy to wanting to be present wherever customers are.</p><p>&#34;E-commerce really exploded,&#34; Ong said. &#34;Our business doubled last year because COVID accelerated everything. We&#39;re expanding very aggressively. So this year we are aiming for $30 to $35 million in terms of our annual sales.&#34;</p><p>Amazon, where KeaBabies first began selling products in October 2017. is far and away the company&#39;s biggest revenue driving platform. With a full suite of services through Fulfillment by Amazon, offering warehousing and delivery, the e-commerce giant simply has the lowest barriers to entry, Ong said.</p><p>In 2020, Amazon saw <a href=\"https://ir.aboutamazon.com/news-release/news-release-details/2021/Amazon.com-Announces-Fourth-Quarter-Results/default.aspx?tag=bisafetynet2-20\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">$386 billion</a> - or 54% of its total net sales - come from third-party sellers. And larger merchants have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-third-party-sellers-ma-on-the-rise-2020-7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">sold</a> their brands for an average of $5 million in 2021, as equity firms begin consolidating corners of the market. Research firm <a href=\"https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=4tNED-2FM8iDZJQyQ53jATUcKGfYeCoCY2xaVxSX3Yobo-3DmymP_bgCe8ihr4o6NyOkoW5UJVrb51Dl1FPa7Eg1lSjvSo92Y5kR9Ms5mZX7fnV8km2cHuxCx1PRIfobH-2FrwX8muOHhkd4-2BMjLYsado3-2F-2Bx3Gb-2FzjKsWfV48PLhf3lj3gvuOFpCY9ovQOQCQoUHF-2B0MRscL1Lo7hhVB4vuyldtJmYrF-2BXKm1uGaLw-2F2BUzATyS2oc23pmKBySzTyb0myhlmLLVLaUXcdk3CzFBRDJ5YMn09xk8M2-2Fty2r-2BRuNnYfGzEof2EYNS3HaSzI4gAyxwDqSSci6eCVc-2BMHCEWGJiQ1nCo3asYp-2BDS6ULmW5NhCLAMfiIv-2BECaiGYdJEYuGSUYWQIR-2BGZ-2F6Bhq663S70SVw8BI8-3D\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn%3D4tNED-2FM8iDZJQyQ53jATUcKGfYeCoCY2xaVxSX3Yobo-3DmymP_bgCe8ihr4o6NyOkoW5UJVrb51Dl1FPa7Eg1lSjvSo92Y5kR9Ms5mZX7fnV8km2cHuxCx1PRIfobH-2FrwX8muOHhkd4-2BMjLYsado3-2F-2Bx3Gb-2FzjKsWfV48PLhf3lj3gvuOFpCY9ovQOQCQoUHF-2B0MRscL1Lo7hhVB4vuyldtJmYrF-2BXKm1uGaLw-2F2BUzATyS2oc23pmKBySzTyb0myhlmLLVLaUXcdk3CzFBRDJ5YMn09xk8M2-2Fty2r-2BRuNnYfGzEof2EYNS3HaSzI4gAyxwDqSSci6eCVc-2BMHCEWGJiQ1nCo3asYp-2BDS6ULmW5NhCLAMfiIv-2BECaiGYdJEYuGSUYWQIR-2BGZ-2F6Bhq663S70SVw8BI8-3D&source=gmail&ust=1616505070812000&usg=AFQjCNEiYk-EgHo7aXL2_sLxdixRgtG0igLxdixRgtG0ig\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"666ef52bf02569cd6cb18697ab2bbb43\">Finbold</a> also found that the online-retail giant is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-pulls-in-thousands-new-independent-sellers-a-day-2021-3\">adding</a> 3,700 new sellers daily in 2021. </p><h2>Every marketplace has its pros and cons</h2><p>While Amazon represents KeaBabies most important marketplace, KeaBabies has also sold items on Walmart Marketplace for about two years.</p><p>Ong said that though total sales on Walmart make up about 5% of the total business the company pulls in on Amazon, the retailer does offer fewer &#34;headaches&#34; because there are currently less competitors on the site, and less instances of saboteurs using &#34;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-sellers-black-hat-tactics-merchants-2021-4\">black-hatting</a>&#34; techniques.</p><p>Meanwhile, Target is comparatively &#34;very selective about who they partner with&#34; compared to most sites. That exclusivity is a plus, according to Ong, because it allows brands to grow without a ton of competition. </p><p>&#34;There&#39;s a different strategy for Target,&#34; he said. &#34;For us to get in, it was about a year of getting our brand in front of the brand acquisition onboarding team, and then presenting our brand and pitching about why we should be on Target. It has been quite a chase.&#34;</p><p>Meanwhile, Kroger proved to be an entirely different story, thanks to the brand&#39;s recent push to expand its baby category that was seeing growth during the pandemic. The Kroger team ended up contacting KeaBabies directly, to onboard them onto their site. </p><p>&#34;It was a pretty easy process for Kroger because they are trying to open up to more brands,&#34; Ong said, adding that the company&#39;s onboarding process was easy-to-navigate.</p><p>As third-party sales continues to grow, more brands will have to contend with attracting an array of retail partners and developing those relationships. But despite the challenges, Ong said the strategy more than pays off in the end.</p><p>&#34;Our customers are modern moms looking to buy affordable but quality stuff for their babies,&#34; he said. &#34;Being on all these platforms lets you really access customers.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/keababies-founder-shares-tips-for-selling-on-amazon-walmart-target-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Cain)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6082e3fc1041d50019f2de80?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn76@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-01-161_13e4079364e5b3bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=kQr9ScX69KI:zBPBZBIsYxE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn33@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-03-035_d493e1716fdee07a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=kQr9ScX69KI:zBPBZBIsYxE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn88@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-56-625_2954adbe95759c0a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=kQr9ScX69KI:zBPBZBIsYxE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn7@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-00-777_a310dbb7d1a0d9c2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/kQr9ScX69KI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn61@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-03-515_726940e427822370.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596240},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"'F--- You': San Francisco LGBTQ Democratic Club sends pointed message to Tucker Carlson","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tucker-carlson-harvey-milk-dan-white-society-yearbook-fox-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9af1006f5b310011724341?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tucker carlson ups package\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Fox News host Tucker Carlson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Harvey Milk LGBTQ Democratic Club slammed Carlson for a 1991 college yearbook entry. </li>\n<li>Carlson&#39;s entry listed that he was part of the &#34;Dan White Society.&#34;</li>\n<li>In 1978, White murdered San Francisco Supervisor Harvey Milk and San Francisco Mayor George Moscone.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>One of San Francisco&#39;s largest Democratic clubs sent a pointed note to Fox News host Tucker Carlson after his old college yearbook revealed a membership in a group that appeared to be named after the killer of the club&#39;s namesake.</p><p>The Harvey Milk LGBTQ Democratic Club, named after California&#39;s first openly gay elected official, had little tolerance for reports that Carlson may have been part of the &#34;Dan White Society.&#34;</p><p><a href=\"https://twitter.com/harveymilkclub/status/1386061665590931459\">Their message</a> was direct: &#34;Dear Mr. Carlson: F--- you.&#34;</p><p>On November 27, 1978, White, a former member of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, fatally shot Supervisor Milk and Mayor George Moscone at San Francisco City Hall in what became one of the darkest days in the city&#39;s history.</p><p>The Democratic club also slammed Carlson&#39;s 1991 yearbook listing as an &#34;exaltation of the murder of Harvey Milk.&#34;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Harvey Milk LGBTQ Democratic Club  (@harveymilkclub) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1386061665590931459?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 24, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p><strong><em>Read more: </em></strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-florida-mar-a-lago-bedminster-golf-2021-4\"><em>Trump plots temporary move from Mar-a-Lago north to New Jersey</em></a></p><p>Trinity College in Hartford, Connecticut, Carlson&#39;s alma mater, <a href=\"https://www.thewrap.com/tucker-carlson-dan-white-yearbook/\">confirmed the authenticity</a> of the yearbook listing to The Wrap. A university representative also told The Wrap that the &#34;society&#34; did not appear to exist at the time and was only listed under Carlson&#39;s entry.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Travis Akers  (@travisakers) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1384882691838025732?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 21, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The entry can also be viewed through a digital copy of the yearbook, with Carlson&#39;s words <a href=\"https://digitalrepository.trincoll.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1120&context=ivy=ivy\">listed</a> on page 186.</p><p>In the entry, Carlson also referred to the &#34;Jesse Helms Foundation,&#34; named after the <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/1995/01/01/us/nomination-of-gay-man-is-dropped.html\">deeply conservative, anti-gay former North Carolina GOP senator</a> who earned the nickname of &#34;Senator No&#34; for <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/05/us/politics/00helms.html\">his repeated blocking</a> of treaties and appointments.</p><p>The fact-checking blog Snopes <a href=\"https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/tucker-carlson-dan-white-society/\">did not locate</a> any other mention of the Jesse Helms Foundation in the yearbook.</p><p>Carlson has not directly discussed the groups listed in his yearbook entry.</p><p>However, a day before news of the yearbook entry spread on social media, Carlson addressed the topic of his college yearbook by <a href=\"https://twitter.com/justinbaragona/status/1384674717873934338\">lashing out</a> at Washington Post owner and Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, along with Post media columnist Erik Wemple.</p><p>&#34;Jeff Bezos had one of his minions, a mentally imbalanced middle-aged man called Erik Wemple, pull our dusty college yearbook and see if we&#39;d done anything naughty at the age of 19,&#34; he said. &#34;That sounds like fun. Let us know if you hear any good stories.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/tucker-carlson-harvey-milk-dan-white-society-yearbook-fox-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ICSj0NbBm6A\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 25 Apr 2021 14:38:22 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9af2bd6f5b310011724352?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d675a8559d49c153b3ed6590b8ef5196","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn93@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-54-526_263d26aa956fee23.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":106238,"destBytes":106238,"author":"insider@insider.com (John L. Dorman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9af1006f5b310011724341?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn83@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-59-604_1eadf36b221d246b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn60@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-55-041_c8f7104f0c3743bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn48@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-57-207_ed58e8d4f1be3061.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ICSj0NbBm6A:XwOF_t9ed9w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn41@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-54-532_1589f4d98b51585e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ICSj0NbBm6A":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-56-578_59b54f61da1c583d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596189},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"A book published almost 25 years ago predicted that the 'Next New Deal' would follow a period of great social unrest in 2020 - and that millennials would take the reins after decades of boomer rule","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-new-economic-regime-fourth-turning-theory-millennials-boomers-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608332b94cd9dd0018e9ed8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"president joe biden\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Could President Joe Biden be the &#34;gray champion&#34; of the Fourth Turning?\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pool/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A generational theory written in 1997 predicted America would see the climax of a crisis in 2020.</li>\n<li>As the climax turned toward resolution, a &#34;Next New Deal&#34; would reshape the economy and give millennials a brighter future.</li>\n<li>A &#34;gray champion&#34; would usher in this new economic zeitgeist. Could that be Biden?</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>America is currently in the midst of a millennial vs. boomer showdown - and a &#34;gray champion&#34; is arriving to usher in the &#34;Next New Deal.&#34;</p><p>So says an eerie generational theory known as the Fourth Turning, which was coined in 1997 by Neil Howe and William Strauss in an <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Fourth-Turning-American-Prophecy-Rendezvous/dp/0767900464\">eponymous book</a>. The theory proposes that America sees a &#34;turning&#34; every 20 years as one generation displaces another, and that this dynamic between the two creates a crisis every 80 years.</p><p>Each crisis is marked by four stages: a catalyst event that sets the wheels in motion; a regeneracy in which people stop tolerating weakening institutions and splintering culture; a climax that &#34;shakes society to its roots,&#34; transforms institutions, and redirects purpose; and a resolution that sees the economy entirely restructured for a new set of circumstances. </p><p>It&#39;s an outlandish theory and the book has also been widely criticized for its<a href=\"https://qz.com/970646/the-world-has-already-bought-into-steve-bannons-apocalyptic-ideology/\"> lack of scientific support</a> and<a href=\"https://archive.nytimes.com/www.nytimes.com/books/97/01/26/reviews/970126.26lindlt.html?_r=1\"> vague predictions</a>. But it&#39;s also resonated among conservative and liberal leaders alike, and bears uncanny parallels to American history. </p><p>The last fourth turnings, Howe and Strauss argued, culminated in World War II, the Civil War, and the American Revolution. They wrote that the next crisis-era would involve<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/millennials-great-recession-student-debt-affordability-crisis-2020-1\"> millennials</a> and boomers fighting over the shape of the world to come, with the catalyst event beginning around 2005, and the climax around 2020, with a resolution by 2026. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ff72bee6d61c10019cce203?format=jpeg\" alt=\"US Capitol riots aftermath\" height=\"1691\" width=\"2254\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Political riots, social unrest, and a pandemic resemble the climax depicted in &#34;The Fourth Turning.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Leah Millis/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/millennial-generation-gap-great-recession-financial-crisis-money-habits-2019-3\"> 2008 financial crisis</a> can be seen as the catalyst they mentioned, while the pandemic, social unrest, and riots of 2020 and early 2021 <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/protests-coronavirus-crisis-fourth-turning-theory-millennials-boomers-2020-6\">sound a lot like the climax</a>. During this climax, they wrote, the economy could &#34;reach a trough that may look to be the start of the depression,&#34; and indeed, the stock-market crash of 2020 was the sharpest and deepest since at least the 1930s. The economy will recover, per the theory, but it will fundamentally change after this period.</p><p>Enter the Biden administration, whose ambitious social programs and big spending have triggered comparisons to FDR&#39;s New Deal. Some leading political experts agree that this era is historic and climactic. For instance, Doug Sosnik, senior adviser to the Brunswick Group, and political director for former President Bill Clinton, <a href=\"https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/20611601-doug-sosnik_brunswick_first-100-days-of-2021_4721-1-3?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=topp;stream=top\">released a presentation in April</a> pronouncing that not only is America going through its biggest transformation since the industrial revolution of the 19th century, but &#34;the current period of turmoil and chaos that began in the early 2000s will likely continue throughout this decade.&#34; </p><p>The challenge, Sosnik wrote, will be the transition from a 20th-century top-down industrial economy to a 21st-century digital and global one. In other words, this period could be a &#34;great gate of history,&#34; just as Strauss and Howe wrote.</p><h2><strong>Forgoing Obama-era rules for a bolder approach</strong></h2><p>The Fourth Turning predicts the agenda of the Next New Deal will center around young adults, with boomers imposing a &#34;new duty of compulsory service&#34; and millennials recognizing this as a path to public achievement. The government&#39;s economic role, per the theory, will shift away from amenities and past promises such as elder care and debt service and toward spending on survival and future promises, such as defense and public works.</p><p>President Joe Biden signaled early on that he wouldn&#39;t bow to the worries over the national debt that dominated much of the last 20 years (ie, the third turning). The president unveiled a $1.9 trillion stimulus package <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-stimulus-plan-details-checks-congress-direct-payments-unemployment-2021-1\">one week before his inauguration</a>, urging Congress to pass another round of relief checks, extend bolstered unemployment benefits, and fund the distribution of coronavirus vaccines.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6008a6da6d4c620018e4121a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"biden president\" height=\"3614\" width=\"4819\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden signs three documents including an Inauguration declaration, cabinet nominations and sub-cabinet nominations on January 20, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">JIM LO SCALZO/POOL/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>For the first time in a generation, economists and consumers alike have since become <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inflation-stimulus-debate-economic-growth-spending-federal-reserve-larry-summers-2021-3\">worried about inflation</a>, and whether such a large boost was even needed as vaccines started to reach Americans&#39; arms. </p><p>Where the Obama administration shrank its proposal to appease Republicans and moderate Democrats, Biden stuck with his plan to &#34;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-stimulus-obama-economic-recovery-policy-infrastructure-unemployment-coronavirus-recovery-2021-3\">go big</a>&#34; and, for the time being, ignore its impact on the government debt. </p><p>&#34;A new resolve about urgent public goals crowds out qualms about questionable public means,&#34; Strauss and Howe wrote. &#34;Instead of coaxing people with promises of minimal sacrifice, they summon them with warnings of maximal sacrifice.&#34;</p><p>This could only be the beginning of the Biden-led resolution. For his second act, could we meet the &#34;Gray Champion?&#34;</p><h2><strong>Spending big on a new age of American infrastructure</strong></h2><p>The authors predicted that a key component of the Next New Deal would be a new era for infrastructure: &#34;Fourth Turning America will begin to lay out the next saeculum&#39;s infrastructure grid - some higher-tech facsimile of turnpikes, railroads, or highways. Through the Fourth Turning, the old order will die, but only after having produced the seed containing the new civic order within it.&#34;</p><p>That&#39;s exactly what Biden is proposing, arguing explicitly in the rollout of his <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-2-trillion-infrastructure-plan-roads-bridges-broadband-power-2021-3\">$2.3 trillion package</a> that now is the time to rethink infrastructure for the first time in decades. It includes funds for nationwide broadband and green energy projects as well as more &#34;traditional&#34; infrastructure such as rebuilding roads and bridges. </p><p>&#34;With the 1936 Rural Electrification Act, the federal government made a historic investment in bringing electricity to nearly every home and farm in America, and millions of families and our economy reaped the benefits,&#34; reads a <a href=\"https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/03/31/fact-sheet-the-american-jobs-plan/\">White House fact sheet</a> on the plan. &#34;Broadband internet is the new electricity.&#34;</p><p>&#34;It&#39;s big, yes. It&#39;s bold, yes. And we can get it done,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-2-trillion-infrastructure-plan-roads-bridges-broadband-power-2021-3\">Biden said as he unveiled the package</a>. &#34;The divisions of the moment shouldn&#39;t stop us from doing the right thing for the future.&#34; He also called it a &#34;once-in-a-generation investment in America.&#34;</p><p>That isn&#39;t all the administration has on the docket. The president is expected to reveal <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-spending-american-families-plan-education-paid-leave-child-care-2021-4\">another $1.5 trillion in spending</a> before he addresses a joint session of Congress on April 28. The plan is set to include funds for child care, universal pre-K, and paid family and medical leave.</p><p>These two packages look a lot like the spending on &#34;public works&#34; and &#34;future promises&#34; that Howe and Strauss predicted would make up the Next New Deal, in some ways they even <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-bidens-stimulus-bigger-than-the-new-deal-fdr-2021-3\">surpass FDR&#39;s New Deal</a> programs. Leonard Burman, a professor of behavioral economics at Syracuse University&#39;s Maxwell School, told Insider&#39;s Juliana Kaplan that compared to FDR, the country has &#34;never done&#34; a package the size of Biden&#39;s proposals. Unlike Biden, he said FDR &#34;spent much less than would have been appropriate for the size of the economic downturn at that point.&#34;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606e0df470954f0019195bde?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Biden\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Biden has framed his American Job Plan as a reimagining of US infrastructure.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Taken together, Biden&#39;s proposals place the country on the brink of a new policy regime. The fierce debate over this new regime is where the millennial versus boomer conflict reaches its fever pitch.</p><p>&#34;In the Fourth Turning, boomers are likely to occupy the vortex of a downward economic spiral,&#34; the authors wrote, as &#34;the truth will dawn on old boomers that the money simply won&#39;t be there to support their accustomed consumption.&#34; But it predicted that millennials will come out of this with a brighter future, as they come to embody a &#34;new American mainstream.&#34;</p><p>Helping the millennials along the way will be a particular figure, Howe and Strauss wrote.</p><p>Eight or nine decades after his last appearance in a similar gate of history, the coauthors predicted, America will be visited by &#34;the figure of an ancient man,&#34; one who combines aspects of &#34;the leader and the saint&#34; to lead the way toward resolution. They called that character the Gray Champion, and said he would be the one to usher in a new economic zeitgeist.</p><p>The 78-year-old Biden, who became <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/biden-inauguration-joe-biden-race-and-ethnicity-ronald-reagan-pennsylvania-48d1659d4469999be87fbd87d560a52c\">America&#39;s oldest president</a> when he was elected in 2020, has several of these attributes, including devout Catholic faith, a biography marked by perseverance through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/president-elect-joe-bidens-grief-could-help-america-heal-2020-11\">several personal tragedies</a>, and a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/psychologist-how-to-lead-with-compassion-empathy-like-joe-biden-2021-1\">distinct sense of empathy</a> in his public remarks. And when he introduced his infrastructure plan last month, he <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-25/biden-promises-a-new-paradigm-in-economic-program-next-week?sref=BLKWHazc\">promised a new economic &#34;paradigm&#34;</a> for the country. This could just be the beginning.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-new-economic-regime-fourth-turning-theory-millennials-boomers-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
