border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/h4wVCDi48Tw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 25 Apr 2021 12:55:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608332b94cd9dd0018e9ed8a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"def26af3ca5a1f2c48978a6c5487e032","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn20@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-36-701_e90f7d7ec37300fa.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":69892,"destBytes":69892,"author":"hhoffower@businessinsider.com (Hillary Hoffower,Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608332b94cd9dd0018e9ed8a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn20@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-36-701_e90f7d7ec37300fa.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ff72bee6d61c10019cce203?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn79@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-55-680_177e791b03f94c5b.webp","https://i.insider.com/6008a6da6d4c620018e4121a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn53@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-02-208_a0d4add7e6db7b12.webp","https://i.insider.com/606e0df470954f0019195bde?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn91@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-55-511_fb19772199a0361f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=h4wVCDi48Tw:CGMW_elceXc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn87@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-02-686_92eac58c6f0ff084.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=h4wVCDi48Tw:CGMW_elceXc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn3@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-56-448_d66532c490e2ec2b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=h4wVCDi48Tw:CGMW_elceXc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn83@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-56-179_eb9af7769805c7b5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/h4wVCDi48Tw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn75@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-03-067_afaa824f24cac3e3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596214},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"I left a life I loved in NYC and moved to a tiny town in rural Vermont during the pandemic. I miss takeout and trash pickup, but overall I'm thrilled with the decision.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/moved-from-nyc-to-rural-vermont-heres-what-its-like-2021-4","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e3fe1041d50019f2de81?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"915\" width=\"1220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My dog in front of our barn during the snowy winter months.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Jessica Frisco is a healthcare director who moved from NYC to rural Vermont during the pandemic.</li>\n<li>She and her fiancé quickly grew fond of their new small town, despite their worries about the change.</li>\n<li>They enjoy more outdoor activities, save on expenses and groceries, and are easily making new friends. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Like millions of New Yorkers who justify their sky-high rents with the opportunity to live out their dreams, I thought NYC was the most incredible place in the world. After seven years in the city, I was thriving with strong friendships, a great job, a beautiful apartment in Williamsburg, and a packed schedule full of activism, exciting nights around town, and taking care of my dog.</p><p>At 28 years old, being a New Yorker felt like a huge part of my identity, and even during the pandemic, I had a difficult time imagining ever leaving.</p><p>But when I stumbled on my dream house in rural southern Vermont, I started imagining the crazy alternative of a life elsewhere. Could anything compare to the buzzing energy of NYC? Though I had always dreamed of owning my own home, I was deeply anxious about the thought of leaving behind my friends, the political causes and networks I had dedicated so much energy to, and the infinite opportunities of the city. NYC was stimulating, challenging, and full of interesting people. </p><p>But believe it or not, so is my new life in Dummerston, Vermont. </p><p>Here&#39;s what it&#39;s like to move from the big city to a tiny, rural hamlet - the main things I was worried about, and how they turned out. </p><h2><strong>Making the leap to Dummerston</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608381011d0b54001913dbb6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"340\" width=\"453\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jessica Frisco in front a cascading waterfall near her home in Dummerston, Vermont.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>I traded in the &#34;rustic chic&#34; aesthetic ubiquitous across Williamsburg (farmhouse decor, hipster lumberjacks) for the real thing. The town I live in now is called Dummerston, a small community of 1,800 filled with dense woods and open farmland.<p>Unfortunately, the Vermont version of &#34;rustic chic&#34; means &#34;needs work,&#34; but my fiancé and I were looking forward to the challenges of getting our property up and running and testing out our handyman skills. It was whether I could make friends and find my purpose in this small town that really had me wondering. </p><h2><strong>Local culture</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e4444becb800190f6d16?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"765\" width=\"1019\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Walking around downtown Brattleboro.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Ten minutes down the road from our house is the main town of Brattleboro, home to a whopping 12,000 people. Despite my initial anxieties, I&#39;ve been impressed by how much there is to do when strolling through the town on a weekend.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e4834becb800190f6d1d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"828\" width=\"1105\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My fiancé and I grabbing craft beers at the local brewery.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The main strip of the historic downtown area overlooks the Connecticut River and is filled with coffee shops, eclectic restaurants, breweries, and thrift stores that even rival those in Brooklyn (except in price.) </p><h2><strong>Home economics</strong></h2><p>While the restaurant scene in Brattleboro and the surrounding area is impressive given the small size of the town, I do miss NYC&#39;s unmatched offerings for takeout and access to literally any cuisine at any time of day. Takeout or a dinner in town has become more of a special occasion than a casual afterthought like it was in the city, especially since most places here close by 9 p.m.</p><p>However, now that I have my own house and lots of kitchen space, I&#39;m cooking much more from my pantry stocked with bulk staples, produce sourced from local farms up the road, and lots of maple syrup.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e4ef1041d50019f2de8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Stocking up on bulk grocery products.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Friends from NYC or family from my hometown in Connecticut come to visit often, and we love having the space to cook and host. Grocery stores in Vermont aren&#39;t actually that much cheaper than in New York, but I&#39;m saving around $250 a month by cooking nearly every meal from home. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e51a1041d50019f2de93?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>We&#39;ve traded takeout for healthy home cooking.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>With all the cooking comes a lot of composting, something that is mandated by the state of Vermont. While there are options for compost and trash disposal, like burying food waste in our yard or hiring a trash service to come by weekly, we&#39;ve landed on making regular trips to the local dump to save money.</p><p>This has been one of the most challenging errands to adapt to, given the labor intensity of sorting by plastic type and garbage category, and that the dump is only open until the afternoon on weekdays and Saturdays. More than once, I&#39;ve lost track of time and had to hang on to bags of food waste and recycling until the next weekend or rush during my lunch break between work meetings.</p><h2><strong>Building up a social life was easier than expected</strong></h2><p>It took me years of living in NYC to build up a circle of friends. New Yorkers are infamously flaky and hard to schedule with, given their packed schedules and competing options. With all the work I had put into my relationships, I was dreading starting from scratch in Dummerston. Yet it&#39;s been shockingly easy, even in a pandemic.</p><p>The slower pace of life makes it easier to catch someone with a free afternoon, and my fiancé and I chat with our passing neighbors or host new friends regularly. We&#39;ve also relied heavily on Facebook, joining the Brattleboro Facebook group and participating in a &#34;Dog Park Pals&#39;&#39; group to seek playdates for our dog (and ourselves).</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e59c4becb800190f6d29?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dogs Jessica Frisco\" height=\"828\" width=\"1104\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>We&#39;ve made friends through local Facebook groups.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Now, neighbors stop by with a carton of eggs or some homemade maple syrup just to say hi, have a playdate with our dogs, or just to check in on how the New Yorkers are managing. </p><h2><strong>Trading rent for a mortgage</strong></h2><p>Of all the things to worry about, the finances of the move were actually quite attractive. In Williamsburg, I paid $1,400 a month for half of an 800 square foot two-bedroom apartment. In Dummerston, my fiancé and I split basically the same cost for a mortgage on an eight-acre property with a house, barn, and a massive shed. Plus, there are heavy tax incentives to leaving NYC and buying a home. </p><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e6931041d50019f2de9e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"711\" width=\"1737\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My apartment in NYC versus my new house in Dummerston.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>That said, home ownership has not come cheap. Without the buffer of a landlord or property manager, we&#39;re on the hook for every maintenance and utility expense. A bitter winter forced us to spend over $1,000 on propane to heat the house, and nearly the same on unexpected plumbing and electrical issues. More space also means more spending on furniture and decorations, and Facebook marketplace is in low supply out here compared with NYC - another thing I miss dearly. </p><p>Overall, in the next five to 10 years, we&#39;ve estimated spending $30,000 or more on home improvement on top of our mortgage. It sounds like a lot, but in New York I was paying $17,000 a year in rent without even getting a fixed-up house to show for it.</p><h2><strong>The politics in rural America aren&#39;t exactly what you think</strong></h2><p>In NYC, I was very politically active and my values were a key factor in deciding where I could live in the future. Though it&#39;s a rural state, Vermont is incredibly liberal and its residents young and old are highly engaged. Yet politics here are hyper-local and more practical than ideological, a change from NYC that I&#39;ve come to appreciate.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e7131041d50019f2dea2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"915\" width=\"1220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Black Lives Matter signs are everywhere in Vermont.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>While I&#39;ve only been here a few months, I&#39;ve already gotten involved in some work on transitioning the town to renewable energy and improving safe police practices.</p><p>I was sad to give up the excitement of the big city and the sense that anything could happen at any time. Yet Vermont is stimulating in its own ways. I&#39;ve been skiing and hiking more than ever before. I&#39;m regularly chasing porcupines and other wildlife away from my dog, and driving down our dirt road often feels like an off-roading adventure.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e7b81041d50019f2dead?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"514\" width=\"685\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Axe throwing is one of our favorite new pastimes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I&#39;ve also come to realize that peace and quiet is not all that bad or boring; in fact, my ability to relax and concentrate has increased significantly, something I didn&#39;t realize how badly I was lacking before the move. </p><h2><strong>Life in Vermont is challenging, in a good way</strong></h2><p>One of the things I loved most about NYC was being constantly challenged, whether it was hustling to get ahead at work or figuring out the quickest subway route. I was always trying to get ahead or get somewhere else. Out in the country, my fiancé and I still work hard, but in different ways, like figuring out how to get <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/i-tried-starlink-beta-vermont-compared-hughes-net-elon-musk-2021-3\">internet in the woods</a> or working through an electrical outage.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6082e8481041d50019f2deba?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jessica Frisco\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My fiancé cutting trees from our backyard to burn in the wood stove to heat the house.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica Frisco</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>We regularly use more power tools than I can count, and I have become an amateur tradesman who can start a generator, split a log, and replace a condensate neutralizer pump on an HVAC system. Now, with all the work and commitments I&#39;ve put into my new home, it feels like I&#39;m building a foundation for the long-term.</p><h2><strong>I&#39;ve been lucky enough to keep my career, at least for now</strong></h2><p>Like many New Yorkers with an office job, the pandemic forced my company to go fully remote which allowed me to move while keeping my job. I&#39;m able to work as a healthcare director from 9-to-5 remotely in our upstairs office room, across from my fiancé. My job may go back to being in-person a few days a month at some point; while the commute to the city will be long, it will give me a chance to visit and see friends. </p><p>Thinking about the long-term, the opportunities in my field local to Vermont are limited. It would be difficult to find a comparable job that wasn&#39;t remote or based elsewhere in the Northeast. But living here has made me think about alternatives I never previously considered, especially given how friendly the state is to small business. Could I get into a trade, or open a retail store? Maybe one day.</p><h2>A new happy place</h2><p>Looking back on my anxieties prior to leaving the big city for a tiny town, I&#39;m sure I was worried about losing a big piece of the identity I had created for myself in NYC: that of a hard worker with a packed schedule, up on culture and politics and surrounded by fascinating people. The move to Dummerston made me realize it was just as much about what I brought to a place as what the place offered me. My new town has all the foundational elements to make an engaging and excellent life here too, and I&#39;m excited to have taken the leap.</p><p>In April, my fiancé and I went back to NYC for a friend&#39;s birthday. The city seemed the same, but I no longer felt like investing in its endless opportunities. I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back for work and to visit friends and family, but from now on, my identity is a bit more centered in my happy place in Dummerston. </p><section data-track-content=\"\" data-post-type=\"post\"><p><em>Jessica Frisco is a director at an NYC-based healthcare network. She is a registered nurse and holds a Master of Public Health degree from Columbia University.</em></p></section><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/moved-from-nyc-to-rural-vermont-heres-what-its-like-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a f/businessinsider?i=Aq-8FTIyMyU:gcpRsL9wggk:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn79@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-58-700_c7dbe7c6e6b02bcc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Aq-8FTIyMyU:gcpRsL9wggk:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn64@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-55-603_2ef86f32cf719ab6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Aq-8FTIyMyU:gcpRsL9wggk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn91@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-57-358_fd4d0c626522d84f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Aq-8FTIyMyU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn92@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-58-370_d067a9a7125d9e66.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596205},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Tucker Carlson calls journalists 'cowards' who act like 'bodyguards for Jeff Bezos'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tucker-carlson-says-journalists-act-like-bodyguards-for-jeff-bezos-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fb04ba91c741f0019ac9db4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tucker-Carlson\" height=\"3360\" width=\"6720\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Fox News host Tucker Carlson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Fox News host Tucker Carlson said Friday that journalists acted like &#34;bodyguards for Jeff Bezos.&#34;</li>\n<li>In an interview with news website Outkick, the primetime host said he &#34;really hated&#34; reporters.</li>\n<li>Carlson did not name specific journalists or media outlets.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Fox News host <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-karen-mcdougal-case-tucker-carlson-2020-9\">Tucker Carlson</a> on Friday issued a fresh attack on journalists, describing them as &#34;cringing animals who are not worthy of respect.&#34;</p><p>In an interview with <a href=\"https://www.outkick.com/tucker-carlson-fox-news/\" data-link-name=\"in body link\">pop culture website Outkick,</a> Carlson said mainstream journalists were &#34;small-minded, status-obsessed, insecure, not that bright, and just not impressive.&#34; </p><p>The primetime host also claimed that their work is not &#34;aimed upwards&#34; and that many reporters &#34;suck up to power.&#34;</p><p>&#34;I just can&#39;t overstate how disgusted I am, not simply by the details of the lying of the medium, but disgusted by the emphasis,&#34; he said, <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/media/2021/apr/24/tucker-carlson-mainstream-us-journalists\">according to the Guardian</a>. &#34;The media is basically Praetorian Guard for the ruling class, the bodyguards for Jeff Bezos. That&#39;s the opposite of what we should have.&#34;</p><p>&#34;It just makes me sick,&#34; he added. &#34;I really hate them.&#34;</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/some-ceos-staying-away-from-fox-news-maria-bartiromo-2021-1\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">CEOs are steering clear of Fox News&#39; Maria Bartiromo and denying her interviews, sources say</a></em></p><p>Carlson went on to criticize journalists for not subjecting <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-net-worth-life-spending-2018-8\">Amazon founder Jeff Bezos</a> to more &#34;intense scrutiny&#34; and said they&#39;re not doing &#34;tough stories&#34; on people with the most power. </p><p>&#34;Jeff Bezos should be subjected to some intense scrutiny since he&#39;s the richest man in the world. He owns the &#39;Washington Post&#39;. He is China&#39;s biggest retailer. I mean, he&#39;s really changed our country,&#34; he said, according to Outkick.</p><p>&#34;And yet, there&#39;s no scrutiny on Jeff Bezos. It&#39;s all, you know, &#39;What a great guy,&#39; and &#39;Jeff Bezos is a genius.&#39; We suck up to power, and we hurt those below us. I can&#39;t think of anything more dishonorable than that,&#34; he added.</p><p>Carlson did not name specific reporters or media outlets.</p><p>The primetime host began his <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-host-tucker-carlson-biography-of-right-wing-superstar-2020-7\">own career in journalism</a> in the early 1990s as a fact-checker for a national conservative journal called &#34;Policy Review.&#34;</p><p>His father, Richard Warner Carlson, was also a journalist who served as the director of the Voice of America during the last years of the Cold War. </p><p>This is not the first time Carlson has attacked journalists.</p><p>Last month, he dedicated two full segments on his show to smearing <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/fox-news-tucker-carlson-conservative-media-taylor-lorenz-culture-war-2021-3\">New York Times technology reporter Taylor Lorenz.</a> He called her &#34;privileged&#34; and dismissed her experience of online abuse as &#34;not real harassment.&#34;</p><p>The Times rebuked Carlson&#39;s comments, writing in a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/NYTimesPR/status/1369747504565256193\" data-link-name=\"in body link\">statement</a> at the time: &#34;In a now familiar move, Tucker Carlson opened his show last night by attacking a journalist. It was a calculated and cruel tactic, which he regularly deploys to unleash a wave of harassment and vitriol at his intended target.</p><p>&#34;Taylor Lorenz is a talented New York Times journalist doing timely and essential reporting. Journalists should be able to do their jobs without facing harassment.&#34;</p><p>Fox News did not immediately respond to Insider&#39;s request for comment.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"I paid $160 to work from a 4-star luxury hotel in LA for the day, and the free coffee and rooftop pool made me feel surprisingly productive","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/remote-work-hotel-luxury-los-angeles-california-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808415c36a8a00185c63fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hotel Figueroa.\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Work Perks program at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>I tested the &#34;Work Perks&#34; remote work program at Los Angeles&#39; luxury Hotel Figueroa.</li>\n<li>The Work Perks program costs $140, about $162 after tax, for a 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. stay.</li>\n<li>The program was a great way to break my work from home routine and offered amenities not found in any office.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tLos Angeles - the home of movie stars and sunshine - has a hidden secret: a luxury downtown hotel with a robust remote work program.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608086124becb800190f65c2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A view\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A view of Downtown Los Angeles from Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tRemote work has been a hot topic since the start of COVID-19, and more companies are now offering full-time remote or flexible work options.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808855c36a8a00185c6421?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9934\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My workstation at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tTo cash in on this trend, Los Angeles-based Hotel Figueroa launched its \"work perks\" program in early June, and about two to three guests use the program every week, Connie Wang, the hotel's managing director, told Insider in an email statement.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608088a54becb800190f65e0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0012\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel received a \"very positive response\" last summer when the program was first unveiled, and its popularity only continued into the fall, according to Wang.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080887dc36a8a00185c6428?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0003\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room key holder at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel has also been in discussions with \"larger companies\" interested in booking its team spaces for remote work.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608088c94becb800190f65e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9944\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Common spaces at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe majority of the hotel's work perk guests live close-by, but want a workspace away from the confines of their homes, according to Wang. I'm sure many can relate to this.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608089054becb800190f65e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0014\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Downtown Los Angeles.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter over a year of working from home, I decided it was time to try out Hotel Figueroa's program.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808415c36a8a00185c63fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hotel Figueroa.\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Work Perks program at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA Work Perks session costs $140, about $162 after tax, per day, and guests have the option to book an overnight stay as well.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608089464becb800190f65eb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9931\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The classic suite in Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel is located in Downtown Los Angeles, just a few blocks away from the Staples Center. I rarely frequent the downtown area, but decided the drive through the traffic would be worth the opportunity to work by a pool under the sun (more to come on that).\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080896dc36a8a00185c6436?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9977\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter an hour of navigating the streets of downtown, I finally found the valet parking lot that was pre-reserved ahead of my arrival.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808992c36a8a00185c643a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0013\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The valet parking sign at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI handed my car keys to the lot attendant and walked right around the corner to check into the hotel.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608089b04becb800190f65f1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0011\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter getting a rundown of the amenities, I waddled over to the elevator with my tote bag full of work gear, tapped my card in the elevator, and headed up to the fifth floor to my temporary office.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808a21c36a8a00185c6443?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9961\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tapping my hotel room key to use the elevator.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel offers three levels of accommodations at varying sizes and amenities: rooms, suites, and signature suites.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808a3f4becb800190f65f7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0005\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tGuests with the work perks session get to work out of the hotel's Classic Suites, which offered more space than I was expecting.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808a864becb800190f65fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9908\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe suite had three separate areas: a bathroom, bedroom, and living room-like space where the workstation was located.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808ad7c36a8a00185c644f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9964\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis suite was nothing like my typical work from home setup, which normally consists of the cheapest desk I could find online, a lamp, an office chair, a half-eaten bowl of oatmeal, and an empty cup of coffee.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808a6cc36a8a00185c6449?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0008\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHere, the two-tiered desk came with built-in outlets, an overhead TV, a thick cushioned seat, and a lamp similar to the one I have at home.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808aba4becb800190f6600?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9907\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My workstation inside my room at at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA couch, coffee table, and some additional seating were all located directly behind the desk.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808af6c36a8a00185c6452?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9897\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAcross the way from this office-living room space was the bedroom, which was lined with a full-length mirror, king bed, and nightstands.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808b0cc36a8a00185c6454?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9902\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe bedroom was also equipped with another wall-mounted TV and an iPad that conveniently displayed the time, weather, and options to play the radio or request guest services. I wasn't sure what all the TVs were for, but I couldn't complain.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808b2dc36a8a00185c6457?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9924\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFinally, the bathroom sits adjacent to the bedroom and comes with two sinks, a giant mirror, and enclosed toilet and shower spaces on either side of the bathroom.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808b72c36a8a00185c645c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9900\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere's even a little espresso maker by the entryway for a constant stream of caffeination …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808b8d4becb800190f660b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9962\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t… but I opted to get a coffee from the complimentary coffee bar downstairs instead.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808bff4becb800190f6611?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9947\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first floor of Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tMy trusty water bottle rarely leaves my side, but if I had accidentally left it at home, I could've used the complimentary in-room water bottles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808c2fc36a8a00185c6465?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9895\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The water bottles in my room.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAesthetically speaking, this is one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever been in (with the caveat that I didn't get a chance to nap on the bed during work, which I'm sure my editor will be glad to hear).\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808c61c36a8a00185c6469?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9898\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhen I finally finished exploring my suite and grabbing coffee downstairs, I settled down at the desk, opened my laptop to free WiFi, and began work.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808ce04becb800190f6617?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9937\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Me, looking very tired, at my desk in my Hotel Figueroa room.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI was initially skeptical about working from a hotel. \"How different could it be than working from home without pajamas on?\" I thought to myself.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808cf8c36a8a00185c646d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9919\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut within the first few minutes, I realized my initial impressions were wrong.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808d3ec36a8a00185c646f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9893\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI found myself being extremely productive in the WiFi and coffee-equipped space.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808d1e4becb800190f6619?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9935\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI enjoy working with some ambient noise, so I decided to have the news playing on TV while I was typing away at a story.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808d9c4becb800190f661f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9934\" height=\"1089\" width=\"2178\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My workstation at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd being alone meant I could read aloud, which I often can't do because I share my home office with the person I live with.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808dcb4becb800190f6621?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9920\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt was nice to work in a space where I had none of my usual distractions, but full access to all of the amenities I could possibly need while working.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808d78c36a8a00185c6471?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9934\" height=\"1077\" width=\"2154\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My workstation at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHowever, I do have one qualm about the suite. The room had two windows and several lights, but the space was still too dim for my liking (I enjoy bright workspaces). But besides this, I have no complaints.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808de44becb800190f6623?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9906\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter a while at my desk, I decided to explore the rest of the hotel.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808e10c36a8a00185c6475?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9932\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The view from my room at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tLike other guests with the program, I opted to work in my private suite and in the common spaces available throughout the hotel.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808e2fc36a8a00185c6477?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9912\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel has several open tables for guests to work at, whether it be by the pool, on the first floor, or at a large outdoor deck on the second floor.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808e6dc36a8a00185c647b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9975\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The second floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI saw several people seated at different nooks around Hotel Figueroa's first floor, keeping to themselves while typing away on their laptops. For a moment, it felt like I was at an upscale coworking space.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808e514becb800190f6626?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9959\" height=\"1726\" width=\"2301\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere are a few reasons why I miss working in Insider's New York office. For one, there were plenty of open tables and seats available for when I needed a change of scenery.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808e8bc36a8a00185c647e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0002\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Brittany Chang/Insider\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel gave me the opportunity to do just that - work wherever I wanted without being too far from my personal desk.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808eabc36a8a00185c6480?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9943\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI still don't feel comfortable sitting in confined indoor spaces for too long, even with a mask on, so I opted to work by the sun-drenched pool instead.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808ec9c36a8a00185c6481?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9980\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tI saw a few unmasked guests lounging in the indoor common spaces and one employee without a mask on, but other than that, I felt safe working in my private room and out by the pool.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808ee8c36a8a00185c6483?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9955\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tMany hotels have upped their cleaning protocols amid COVID-19. This includes Hotel Figueroa, which sanitizes its rooms and leaves them empty for at least a full day in-between guests.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608089d3c36a8a00185c643e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9892\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The hallway on the fifth floor of Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere was also a steady supply of hand sanitizers near commonly touched surfaces, including one inside the elevator, and one by the hotel's pool entrance.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608089fcc36a8a00185c6440?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9948\" height=\"1299\" width=\"1732\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter a few hours of working and exploring with no snacks or a meal, I decided to order lunch and a juice (I am in Los Angeles after all) while seated at my nook by the pool.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808f09c36a8a00185c6485?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9988\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My very spicy juice.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel's restaurant, a Mexican-inspired Veranda Al Fresco, is right by the swimming area, which means hungry remote workers can lounge under the sun, eat, and work at the same time.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808f46c36a8a00185c6488?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9999\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The restaurant by the pool.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter a few minutes of indecision while staring at the menu, I settled on the elote bowl and a spicy fireball juice. The former felt like a glorified Chipotle bowl (that's a good thing), while the latter was too spicy for my then-empty stomach to drink. The total came out to over $30, not including tip.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808f63c36a8a00185c648a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9992\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My lunch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBesides access to different workspaces, the work perks session also offers free Wi-Fi, a copy machine, and a printer …\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808fab4becb800190f662e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9985\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t… and access the hotel's gym, which is equipped with two Pelotons that I didn't get the chance to use.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60808fcf4becb800190f6630?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9969\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The hotel&#39;s gym.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter a few productive hours and lunch, I decided it was time to wrap up my workday. I gathered up my belongings from the pool and suite and marched out to the valet parking lot where I began my traffic-filled drive back home.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080901fc36a8a00185c6494?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9891\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Me, my bags, and the elevator.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe program is open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., but I decided to leave early because I'm still working East Coast hours while I'm temporarily located in California.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080903f4becb800190f6635?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_0010\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The lobby of Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOverall, I enjoyed my $160 Work Perks experience and would do it again if I could afford to.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608090744becb800190f6636?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9916\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My coffee at Hotel Figueroa room key.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt felt like a great way to break up the work week, which often makes me feel bogged down and stressed at home.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608090af4becb800190f663a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9953\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The pool at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt felt luxurious working from a hotel room that was over twice the size of my home office. And having amenities like a gym, free coffee, and bottled water was a huge plus, even if I didn't have time to take advantage of everything the hotel had to offer.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608090d2354dde0018c067d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9971\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The gym.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe hotel also had great service - any questions I had were answered kindly and promptly.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608090fa4becb800190f663d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9913\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHowever, there's no denying that $160 is expensive for an eight-hour daytime hotel stay. That price is pretty much comparable to an overnight stay at other hotels.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6080911a354dde0018c067d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9899\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iPad in my room.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis price point likely makes it inaccessible for the majority of remote workers looking for a new permanent office solution.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608091d2354dde0018c067e1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9972\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The second floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut if you're sitting on a pile of cash and feeling burnt out from working from home,  I'd highly recommend booking a Hotel Figueroa Work Perks session, especially if you plan on using its gym and pool.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608091ac354dde0018c067df?format=jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_9946\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first floor at Hotel Figueroa.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Chang/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a cb800190f65f7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn67@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-58-022_df9e8747d99bfe5a.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808a864becb800190f65fc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn45@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-03-515_c3f9788f6c3d32fb.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808ad7c36a8a00185c644f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn8@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-57-405_de2f9ea4ad1cd79b.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808a6cc36a8a00185c6449?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn93@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-01-539_420937fe99a3bb3a.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808aba4becb800190f6600?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn24@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-56-258_611dc715f49596f0.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808af6c36a8a00185c6452?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn43@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-56-015_46c09db3ba761eaf.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808b0cc36a8a00185c6454?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn84@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-59-124_f9c861337f3eeb03.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808b2dc36a8a00185c6457?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn41@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-01-674_f6414dc4891cf5b4.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808b72c36a8a00185c645c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn11@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-59-967_268a675e6e9748b8.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808b8d4becb800190f660b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn31@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-58-570_15709d2cd113a5e6.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808bff4becb800190f6611?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn87@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-01-081_34a9e988f1ccd7ff.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808c2fc36a8a00185c6465?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn28@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-613_8017bb3ca1718d39.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808c61c36a8a00185c6469?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/m 82ab.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808e8bc36a8a00185c647e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn87@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-57-387_21567aa418ccc03b.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808eabc36a8a00185c6480?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn20@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-27-00-758_0d3b1eddf12826c4.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808ec9c36a8a00185c6481?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn40@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-57-628_a392c5d915a8c663.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808ee8c36a8a00185c6483?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn3@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-55-793_018715028869dc79.webp","https://i.insider.com/608089d3c36a8a00185c643e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn67@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-27-00-250_29d39a34a363b096.webp","https://i.insider.com/608089fcc36a8a00185c6440?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn24@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-03-341_1018bbfc8da8a8a7.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808f09c36a8a00185c6485?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn12@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-58-886_f729b0a0976f40c0.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808f46c36a8a00185c6488?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn36@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-57-507_245e41c675ef29ef.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808f63c36a8a00185c648a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn6@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-02-375_885e28d7058e603c.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808fab4becb800190f662e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn91@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-56-194_07a05d62459502c8.webp","https://i.insider.com/60808fcf4becb800190f6630?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-58-867_1d75a4f4b0ca743c.webp","https://i.insider.com/6080901fc36a8a00185c6494?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn63@2020_2/2021/04/25/17-26-56-061_1d98f181bd153393.webp","https://i.insider.com/6080903f4becb800190f6635?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn52@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-03-145_59c6b5942e1b27d0.webp","https://i.insider.com/608090744becb800190f6636?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn87@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-58-456_c6061add61235d68.webp","https://i.insider.com/608090af4becb800190f663a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn63@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-57-275_88a62c3bda67b8a4.webp","https://i.insider.com/608090d2354dde0018c067d4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn67@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-00-635_9057cdc531e6d1bd.webp","https://i.insider.com/608090fa4becb800190f663d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn16@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-00-403_f1582c81f6cf6428.webp","https://i.insider.com/6080911a354dde0018c067d8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn100@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-55-094_9d2db642dcae1f34.webp","https://i.insider.com/608091d2354dde0018c067e1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn51@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-55-724_95ce7ba73e0f3cc7.webp","https://i.insider.com/608091ac354dde0018c067df?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn23@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-00-187_71ee5346ae8cb923.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cIyVseemW2A:CbMwzcVCCuU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn79@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-27-00-202_f978c65ef672dc3a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cIyVseemW2A:CbMwzcVCCuU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn51@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-57-213_9382f8a813178cfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=cIyVseemW2A:CbMwzcVCCuU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn19@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-59-746_f2d84ea7b330fd8f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/cIyVseemW2A":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn55@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-26-55-968_9474a04a12498a36.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596272},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"Immigration backlogs for qualified workers are threatening America's economic recovery. Biden could fix the issue in a heartbeat if he wanted.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-fix-immigration-backlogs-economy-visa-application-screening-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081d0614becb800190f69fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joe Biden\" height=\"1704\" width=\"3408\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden holds the first news conference of his presidency at the White House on March 25, 2021. He faced questions about the pandemic, immigration, gun control.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A backlog in issuing work visas has been caused due to US consulates being closed or short staffed.</li>\n<li>This delay represents one of the most urgent setbacks affecting immigrants in the US right now.</li>\n<li>Fixing this backlog would boost our economic recovery and requires no legislative effort.</li>\n<li>Madhuri Kumar and Hera Javed are immigration attorneys at J&#38;K Law.</li>\n<li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>This week the Biden Administration <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-administration-to-allow-work-visa-ban-to-expire-11617204628?st=c9x1elwughpvzt1&reflink=article_gmail_sharehare\">ended</a> the previous administration&#39;s ban on new work-based visas, an important step to bringing foreign workers to fill critical jobs inside the US But to quickly help the American economy, the Biden Administration must make sure that approved foreign workers are actually able to enter the US. </p><p>There are currently hundreds of thousands of people who the government has already approved to work in the United States but cannot because US consulates are either closed or experiencing staff shortages, creating a backlog in issuing work visas. For example, currently appointments for H-1B visas are not available in London, Berlin, Rio de Janeiro, and Johannesburg, which means an applicant&#39;s job in the US will go unfilled indefinitely. These unprecedented delays are causing severe ramifications for the US economy as many qualified entrepreneurs, business owners, technology industry professionals, and artists cannot begin working.</p><h2>A no-brainer policy fix</h2><p>Fixing this backlog would not only boost our recovery but also requires no legislative effort. President Biden can immediately reform how consulates issue work visas by waiving the in-person interview requirement.</p><p>The contributions foreign workers make to the United States are staggering. Consider just H-1B visa holders. Every year, H-1B visa holders <a href=\"https://www.stilt.com/blog/2020/06/the-true-economic-impact-of-h1b-visa-holders/\">pump</a> $76.7 billion back into the economy, spending three-quarters of that money on businesses in their communities alone. H-1B visa holders also invest more than $12 billion annually in US businesses, which fuels innovation and research.</p><p>H-1B visa holders also contribute $27 billion per year to Social Security and Medicare even though they are ineligible to participate in these programs. That means without these workers, these important programs would suffer, and may sooner face insolvency.</p><p>And even though H-1B visas are capped at a mere 85,000 a year, for every two H-1B visas that are issued, the US government creates four more jobs for US-born workers. By themselves, H-1B visa holders are not just spenders and investors, but job creators as well.</p><p>The proposed US Citizenship Act would increase the cap on H-1B visas. But there is a backlog in issuing already approved worker visas for workers including artist visas, intracompany transfers, and investor visas.</p><p>The simplest and quickest fix would be to allow consulates to issue visas and waive the requirement for in-person interviews altogether. Although the Administration has expanded the ability of consular officers to waive certain in-person interviews, this does not universally apply to everyone. However, it should. Workers should not have to attend consulate interviews during the pandemic, especially considering the visa petitions have already been approved by the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS).</p><p>Likewise, USCIS should expedite work authorizations for those already in the United States. By law, a person with a pending green card application, DACA recipients, and certain derivative visa holders, among other categories, are permitted to work in the United States. However, they cannot work until they receive an employment authorization card. Before the pandemic, it took two to three months for the employment authorizations to arrive. Now, the wait time has doubled to six to nine months.</p><p>It makes no sense that people who are legally allowed to live here should wait that long to work. This delay represents one of the most urgent setbacks affecting immigrants in the US right now, as it effectively prevents people from working at all. In 2018, a federal district judge ruled that USCIS must issue work authorizations within 30 days to someone who files for asylum. The Biden administration could easily direct USCIS to expedite work authorizations for green card applicants under the same time frame.</p><p>As practitioners who help people obtain employment visas and work authorization, we know from experience that these fixes will jump-start the economy and reduce government waste. If President Biden is serious about reforming our immigration system while ensuring a swift economic recovery from the pandemic, he can start right now.</p><p><em>Madhuri Kumar and Hera Javed are immigration attorneys at J&#38;K Law.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"A 'FinTok' star decided to buy tickets to see Dallas Mavericks with Dogecoin and Mark Cuban stepped in to help - here's what she told us about the experience","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/dogecoin-mavericks-mark-cuban-tiktok-robinhoodkid-tickets-fintok-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60852de33f0560001881be6f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The TikTok star Kayla Kilbride.\" height=\"1478\" width=\"2957\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kayla Kilbride</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Financial TikTok star Kayla Kilbride bought tickets to see Mark Cuban&#39;s Dallas Mavericks using Dogecoin.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">Mavericks owner and cryptocurrency fan Cuban helped her make the purchase. </li>\n<li>Dogecoin, often referred to as a meme coin, rose by as much as 600% this month to record highs.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/10-things-opening-bell?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Sign up here for our daily newsletter, 10 Things Before the Opening Bell.</a></li>\n</ul><p>TikTok star Kayla Kilbride, known online as &#39;Robinhoodkid&#39;, isn&#39;t just a Dallas Mavericks fan with a fascination for financial markets.</p><p>Mavericks owner and cryptocurrency advocate Mark Cuban has long cheered the fortunes of meme coin Dogecoin, to the point where last month he said fans could buy anything from basketball games, to merchandise, using it. </p><p>So 24-year old Kilbride decided to put Cuban&#39;s offer to the test.  She already owned the Dogecoin. It was just a matter of buying her tickets to the game and booking her return flight to Dallas from Los Angeles. </p><p>&#34;The Mavs have been very forward. Specifically, Mark Cuban has been very forward of like, almost the ease of using Dogecoin to buy Mavs merch and tickets,&#34; Kilbride told Insider. </p><p>&#34;That is where it came from. If people are saying that I can use it, I want to try it.&#34;  </p><p>&#34;I&#39;m not just doing it for the sake of hype&#34;, she said. </p><p>Despite saying just this week he couldn&#39;t make sense of the huge jump in the value of Dogecoin, &#34;Shark Tank&#34; star Cuban has been a cheerleader for the cryptocurrency. The Mavericks, which he owns, started <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/mark-cubans-dallas-mavericks-will-accept-dogecoin-for-tickets-2021-3-1030151539\">accepting the coin as a payment method</a> in early March and have <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/mark-cuban-dogecoin-dallas-mavericks-largest-merchant-price-prediction-2021-3-1030158472?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">made 122,000 Dogecoins with merchandise</a> sales, he tweeted earlier this month. </p><p>Putting her dogecoin earnings of the week towards a Mavericks game just seemed like the right thing to do, Kilbride <a href=\"https://twitter.com/robinhoodkid/status/1384126603853139968?s=20\">tweeted</a> earlier this week. Once she had decided to try out the process, Kayla booked a flight to Texas for the game - despite not yet having purchased the tickets for it. </p><p>After spending hours unsuccessfully trying to purchase tickets herself, only to find there were none available, she directly tweeted Cuban, who responded almost immediately and connected her to the Mavericks ticketing sales team, enabling her to make the purchase - an amazing experience for her as a creator, she said.</p><p>&#34;I&#39;m just trying to convey the story that they&#39;re telling as well and confirm their stories, so I&#39;m incredibly grateful and I grew up watching Shark Tank, so that&#39;s obviously a really big deal for me,&#34; she said. &#34;I&#39;m just trying not to &#39;fangirl&#39;.&#34; </p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kraken-ceo-says-bitcoin-could-reach-250k-shares-two-trends-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The CEO of crypto exchange Kraken breaks down why he could &#39;easily&#39; see Bitcoin reach $250,000 next year - and shares 2 emerging trends he&#39;s excited about</a></em></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60852e8f0da8f4001803351d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Kayla Kilbride at the Mavericks game\" height=\"2268\" width=\"3023\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kayla Kilbride</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Dogecoin has gained almost 350% so far in April, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/dogecoin-price-record-high-doge-day-cryptocurrencies-bitcoin-ether-2021-4-1030321679?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">rallying to record highs</a>, as celebrities from Cuban himself, to Tesla boss Elon Musk have tweeted about it.</p><p>To Kilbride, who has almost 100,000 followers on her financial TikTok account - a decent following for a niche area beyond the classic lip-syncing and dance routines that tend to feature on the video-sharing app - Dogecoin is more than the joke that led to its creation in 2013.</p><p>&#34;Yes, it is a meme coin, it&#39;s a joke, it started as a joke, but it has been modified in order to provide some sort of, I would almost argue, educational value to the coin itself. Not just to crypto, but also to the currencies, the fiat currencies that we use as well,&#34; she said. </p><p>She invested in it months ago and was in the process of switching to a Dogecoin Core wallet when it exploded in price and so had to buy back in at a higher rate. </p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/crypto-investing-arca-cio-shares-10-tokens-special-situations-strategy-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The investing chief of crypto asset manager Arca shares the 3 themes and 10 tokens he&#39;s betting on - and explains how to execute his special-situations investing strategy in digital assets</a></em></p><p>This is not the first time Cuban has taken notice of the likes of Kilbride and her peers on TikTok. &#34;For those of you who would like to learn more about Dogecoin, we strongly encourage you to talk to your teenagers who are on TikTok and ask them about it. They will be able to explain it all to you,&#34; Cuban said when he announced the Mavericks would accept payment in Dogecoin.</p><p>Kilbride said she is keen to talk to Cuban himself about Dogecoin more and tried to use social media to get an interview with him at the game on Thursday this week, when the Mavericks beat the Detroit Pistons 127 to 117. </p><p>&#34;He literally talks about how TikTokers are the ones educating the young and the old, because the young are then educating their parents on how to use Dogecoin and I&#39;m like &#39;If you&#39;re willing to respond to a TikToker, I&#39;ll show you how it&#39;s done&#39;,&#34; Kilbride said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (Sophie Kiderlin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60852de33f0560001881be6f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn44@2020_1/2021/04/25/17-27-02-491_cdaba7699d46e7c1.webp","https://i.insider.com/60852e8f0da8f4001803351d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn47@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-27-02-590_c658ca40144132b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-27-01-639_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1nINmkAt-QI:YQ9HzqkVJaU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn79@2020_6/2021/04/25/17-26-55-126_d9534fef1db8fc49.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1nINmkAt-QI:YQ9HzqkVJaU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn57@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-27-03-530_f5f32863dd906d93.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_3/2021/04/25/17-26-58-549_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1nINmkAt-QI:YQ9HzqkVJaU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn39@2020_4/2021/04/25/17-26-59-374_55bb2525c3664657.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/1nINmkAt-QI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn36@2020_5/2021/04/25/17-26-56-683_ec981e7ff5c4478c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619371596199},{"createdTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","updatedTime":"2021-04-26 01:26:36","title":"A mini replica of the Suez Canal in a French lake is helping mariners learn the lessons of the Ever Given blockage","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/mini-suez-canal-replica-helps-mariners-learn-lessons-of-ever-given-jam-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60852bf30da8f40018033517?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ever given replica\" height=\"750\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A scaled-down model of a container ship at the Port Revel Training Centre in France (L) vs. the actual Ever Given ship in the Suez Canal in Egypt (R).\n<p class=\"copyright\">Xinhua/Ahmed Gomaa via Getty Images/Stephane Mahe via Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A training facility in a French lake is helping mariners navigate the world&#39;s trickiest waterways.</li>\n<li>The lake contains a mini version of the Suez Canal, which is replicated on a 1/25th scale.</li>\n<li>Owners of the facility say they&#39;ve seen a spike in interest after the Ever Given crisis last month.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A training facility in a lake in eastern France, which replicates some of the busiest trading routes in the world, has seen a surge in interest after the colossal container ship, the Ever Given, became wedged in the  <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/boat-stuck-suez-canal-costing-estimated-400-million-per-hour-2021-3-1030248237\">Suez Canal </a>last month.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-6\">The Port Revel facility, located in a lake on the foothills of the Alps in Saint-Pierre-de-Bressieux, is designed to help mariners and ship captains navigate crucial shipping channels.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-2\">The replicas of the different waterways, including the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/suez-canal-shipping-backlog-caused-ever-given-to-end-imminently-2021-4?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">Suez Canal</a>, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/san-francisco-lost-89000-households-during-pandemic-usps-data-2020-12?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">San Francisco Bay</a>, and Port McArthur in the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dead-zone-gulf-of-mexico-low-oxygen-water-2019-6?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">Gulf of Mexico,</a> are made to be as realistic as possible, built to one twenty-fifth the scale of the real ones.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-2\"><strong><em>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/4-big-losers-of-the-suez-canal-fiasco-and-4-big-winners-2021-3?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" data-e2e-name=\"inline-read-more-link\">The 4 biggest losers of the Suez Canal fiasco - and 4 surprising winners</a></em></strong></p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-2\">Trainees at the facility have to learn how to maneuver scale models of massive container ships without getting stuck in narrow channels, facing strong underwater currents, and machine-generated waves while doing so.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-2\">Instructors can also simulate steering problems and engine outages to see how the trainees react.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60852e7b3f0560001881be70?format=jpeg\" alt=\"replica suez canal ever given\" height=\"2665\" width=\"3553\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Instructor Philippe Boulanger talks to pilots as they steer a scaled-down model of a container ship, named the Spirit of Port Revel, during a training course on a lake at the Port Revel Shiphandling Training Centre in Saint-Pierre-de-Bressieux, France, on April 19, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stephane Mahe via Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p data-testid=\"paragraph-8\">Francois Mayor, the managing director of Port Revel, told <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/oddly-enough/french-lake-mariners-learn-how-not-get-stuck-suez-canal-2021-04-21/\">Reuters</a> that the training facility has seen a spike in interest following the chaos caused by the Ever Given container ship, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ever-given-logged-speed-limit-before-running-aground-suez-2021-3?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">which ran aground amid a sandstorm</a> in March and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ships-divert-to-older-channel-ever-given-blocks-suez-canal-2021-3\">blocked the Suez Canal</a> for six dramatic days.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-8\">He said it may prompt shipping companies to send their staff for refresher courses.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\">&#34;After each accident ... we see new clients coming,&#34; said Mayor, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/oddly-enough/french-lake-mariners-learn-how-not-get-stuck-suez-canal-2021-04-21/\">according to Reuters.</a> &#34;The cost of training at Port Revel is nothing like the cost of having a vessel like that stuck for a day.&#34;</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\"></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60852e973f0560001881be71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ever Given, Suez Canal\" height=\"2772\" width=\"3696\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Container ship Ever Given stuck in the Suez Canal, Egypt on March 27, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kristin Carringer/Maxar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\">Mayor also said that while the facility has multiple machines to simulate different environments for the maritime pilots, it is &#34;a bit hard to recreate sandstorm.&#34; </p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\">&#34;But we have gusts of wind which will push our ship to one side or another,&#34; he added. &#34;You have little space to maneuver. You have to be particularly focussed.&#34; </p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\"></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6085496b0da8f40018033527?format=jpeg\" alt=\"port revel france suez canal\" height=\"995\" width=\"1326\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Francois Mayor, managing director of Port Revel, steers a scaled-down model of a tanker, named the Brittany, on a lake at the Port Revel Shiphandling Training Centre in Saint-Pierre-de-Bressieux, France, on April 19, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stephane Mahe/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\">While the Ever Given might have been freed from the banks of the Suez Canal - with the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/suez-canal-authority-says-ever-given-digger-driver-overtime-pay-2021-4\">help of tugboats and excavators</a> - the 1,300-foot ship remains trapped in Egypt.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\">Last week, the Suez Canal Authority said they won&#39;t release the ship until its owners agreed to pay up to <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/egypt-billion-compensation-ever-given-incident-suez-canal-2021-4\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"56b718efc7669f29192d91accc236467\">$1 billion in compensation</a>.</p><p data-testid=\"paragraph-9\">The ship and the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ever-given-crew-safe-getting-paid-while-ship-under-investigation-2021-4\">25-person Indian crew of sailors</a> currently remain at anchor in Egypt&#39;s Great Bitter Lake.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
